0.title: 3 men run over by train while changing railway tracks in Gurugram
0.article_body: At least three carpenters, who went for a walk on railway tracks, were run over by a train in Gurugram, police said. "The deceased saw an approaching train...jumped across to the other track, where another passenger train was coming from the opposite direction," police added. "While changing the track, they didn't notice the second train...were run over," police further said.

1.title: Water supply in Hyderabad to be affected today over repair works
1.article_body: Parts of Hyderabad will be facing a water supply cut due to repair and maintenance work undertaken on water pipelines till 6 pm today. About 3.5 lakh residents are expected to be affected. While Mehdipatnam, Kakatiyanagar and Humayun Nagar will face partial cut, a complete water cut will be visible in areas including Mir Alam, Santoshnagar, Narayanguda and Adikmet.

2.title: Ramayan actress Dipika wrongly tags Pakistan PMO in Independence Day tweet
2.article_body: Ramayan actress Dipika Chikhlia wrongly tagged Pakistan PMO in her tweet on India's Independence Day. She shared a picture of herself holding the Tricolour, and wrote, "Happy Independence Day @PakPMO." The actress deleted the tweet after being trolled and posted a video on Instagram.

3.title: Twitter ordered to give Musk fired employee's bot data amid lawsuit
3.article_body: Twitter has been ordered to provide documents from one of its former employees to Elon Musk on bot accounts amid the lawsuit. Kayvon Beykpour, former consumer product head, was fired in May during his paternity leave. Musk's lawyers had requested documents from 22 Twitter employees whom they said had data on Twitter's process of analysing bot accounts.

4.title: I am buying Manchester United: Elon Musk
4.article_body: Tesla Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk on Tuesday said he is buying football club Manchester United. The team is controlled by the American Glazer family, who did not immediately respond to a request for comment. The football club had a market capitalisation of $2.08 billion, as of Tuesday's stock market close.

5.title: Tamil Nadu records 670 new COVID-19 cases, zero fatalities
5.article_body: Tamil Nadu recorded 670 new COVID-19 cases and zero fatalities in the last 24 hours, the Health Department said. So far, 35,60,161 COVID-19 cases have been reported in the state and the death toll remained at 38,033, as per a bulletin. With 927 recoveries in the last 24 hours, currently, there are 6,888 active infections.

6.title: Indian defence attaché now has unescorted access to Pentagon: US
6.article_body: US Air Force Secretary Frank Kendall has said the Indian defence attaché now has unescorted access to the Pentagon. He said the move is in line "with India's status as a major defence partner". "And if you don't think unescorted access to the Pentagon is a big deal, I can't get into the Pentagon without an escort," he said.

7.title: Everyone's become too critical: Huma on boycott culture against B'wood
7.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi said people have become "too negative" towards the Hindi film industry. "A few films have not worked and everyone is ready to write everyone's obituary," she said reacting to people's "critical" opinions on recent releases. She asked the audience to be "kinder" and wait for "good films". On the work front, Huma's upcoming release is 'Maharani 2'.

8.title: Shah, Nadda meet Bihar BJP core group as Nitish Kumar expands Cabinet
8.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah and BJP National President JP Nadda attended a Bihar BJP core committee meeting on Tuesday. The leaders were likely to discuss BJP's future course of action and the strategy for 2024 Lok Sabha polls, reports said. The meeting comes on the day CM Nitish Kumar expanded his Cabinet and 31 leaders were sworn-in as ministers.

9.title: Activist Teesta Setalvad moves SC seeking bail in Gujarat riots case
9.article_body: Social activist and journalist Teesta Setalvad has moved the Supreme Court seeking bail in the Gujarat riots case. The court will hear her bail petition on August 22. Setalvad was arrested for allegedly fabricating evidence to frame "innocent people" in the 2002 riots case. Earlier, an Ahmedabad sessions court denied bail to Setalvad and ex-DGP RB Sreekumar in the case.

10.title: Can't wait for audience to see your magic in Adipurush: Kriti to Saif
10.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon on Tuesday wished her 'Adipurush' co-star Saif Ali Khan on his birthday. "Happy Birthday, Saif! It's been a pleasure working with you and getting to know you," she wrote on Instagram Stories. She said she cannot wait for the audience to see Saif's "madness and magic" in 'Adipurush', which also stars Prabhas in a lead role.

11.title: Ajith to shoot AK61's final schedule in Visakhapatnam: Reports
11.article_body: Tamil actor Ajith Kumar has reportedly reached Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh on Tuesday to shoot for the final schedule of his upcoming film, which is tentatively titled 'AK61'. As per the reports, the crew has finished shooting 70% of the film, while they will soon complete the remaining. The H Vinoth directorial will see Ajith in a double role.

12.title: Wimbledon finalist Kyrgios opts out of Australia's Davis Cup team
12.article_body: Wimbledon finalist Nick Kyrgios has opted out of Australia's Davis Cup finals group stage team for next month. Kyrgios has skipped the team event since 2019. Australia are drawn in Pool C for the September 13-18 finals in Hamburg. "It would've been great to have...Kyrgios in...team but unfortunately he was unavailable for this tie," said team captain Lleyton Hewitt.

13.title: Home decor firm Sunday Design raises ₹12.5 cr in pre-Series A round
13.article_body: Furniture and home decor brand Sunday Design has raised ₹12.5 crore in a pre-Series A funding round. The capital was raised from QRG Investments & Holdings (the family office of Havells India Limited founders), Kama Group (family office of SRF Ltd) and KCT family office, among others. Since its launch, the brand claims to have recorded a 10% month-on-month growth.

14.title: CM Yogi Adityanath-led Cabinet approves UP Jail Manual 2022
14.article_body: The CM Yogi Adityanath-led UP Cabinet on Tuesday approved the proposal to release the UP Jail Manual 2022 which has incorporated guidelines issued by the Central government and courts periodically. This move means the British-era jail manual will be discarded. The old manual had obsolete provisions like transferring prisoners to the Andamans and separate lock-ups for European inmates.

15.title: There's a crisis of confidence in UN system today: Rajnath Singh
15.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, while virtually addressing the Moscow Conference on International Security, said the United Nations (UN) may 'lose its effectiveness' without democratising its decision-making. He said the major powers are refusing to change UN institutions as per the emerging geo-political realities. Singh added that there is a "crisis of confidence" today in the UN system.

16.title: Dearness allowance hiked by 6% for govt employees in Chhattisgarh
16.article_body: Chhattisgarh government on Tuesday announced a 6% hike in the dearness allowance (DA) for state government employees under the 7th Pay Commission. The DA has been hiked by 15% for people under the 6th Pay Commission. This will benefit almost 3.8 lakh people and put an additional burden of ₹2,160 crore/year on the state government exchequer, PTI reported.

17.title: New Polish school textbook draws criticism for fertility passage
17.article_body: A new high school textbook in Poland has attracted criticism from government critics as an attempted "indoctrination of young people". A passage on fertility in the book reads: "Increasingly sophisticated methods...lead to the treatment of sex as entertainment and fertility as human production...who will love the children thus produced?" Poland's Education Ministry has defended the book.

18.title: Both Gill and Dhawan are in good form, they can open in Zimbabwe: Kaif
18.article_body: Mohammad Kaif has said that both Shubman Gill and Shikhar Dhawan can open for India in the upcoming three-match ODI series against Zimbabwe as they are in good form, adding that KL Rahul can come down at number three. "Rahul needs match practice and he was injured...It's his wish where he wants to bat as he is captain," he added.

19.title: Making money is best defence against funding winter: Nandan Nilekani to startups
19.article_body: Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani said that making money is best defence against funding winter  for startups. He added that startups need to focus on lowering the cost of acquiring customers and asked them to make money organically and not splurge on advertisements. In the wake of investments into India's startup ecosystem, Nilekani also advised companies to prioritise profitability over growth.

20.title: Akshay & Rakul Preet to shoot for a special dance number: Reports
20.article_body: Akshay Kumar and Rakul Preet Singh will reportedly shoot for a special dance number for their upcoming film. A report said that choreographer Ahmed Khan has been roped in to design the song, which will be shot in Kandivali, Mumbai. The film, which is tentatively titled 'Production No 41', is said to be the Hindi remake of Tamil film 'Ratsasan'.

21.title: Great performance: Vijender on Indian boxing contingent's 7 medals at CWG 2022
21.article_body: Olympic bronze medal-winning boxer Vijender Singh praised the Indian boxing contingent's performance at the recently concluded Commonwealth Games 2022, saying they delivered a "great" performance in Birmingham. India won three gold, one silver and three bronze medals. "I'm really proud of them," he added. Nikhat Zareen, Nitu Ghanghas and Amit Panghal won gold medals for India.

22.title: Paytm partners with Samsung, allows buy now, pay later at stores
22.article_body: Paytm has partnered with Samsung stores across the country to allow smart payments through its postpaid or buy-now-pay-later (BNPL) service with a credit limit of up to ₹60,000 per month. Paytm will deploy point-of-sale (POS) devices enabling consumers to purchase Samsung products through its payment instruments. No Cost EMI alternatives will also be available for POS device payments.

23.title: Samyukt Kisan Morcha rejects Centre's MSP panel meeting
23.article_body: The Samyukt Kisan Morcha (SKM) leaders have said that they would not attend the upcoming meeting of the Centre's panel set up for making the Minimum Support Price (MSP) more effective. Calling the meeting a 'farce', the SKM said that it doesn't expect any conclusive result from it. The first meeting of the MSP panel is scheduled for August 22.

24.title: Russia fines Twitch ₹25.9 crore over 31-second 'fake' Ukraine clip
24.article_body: A Russian court has fined California-based streaming service Twitch two million roubles (₹25.9 crore) for allegedly hosting "fake" content related to its military campaign in Ukraine, local media reported. As per the reports, the court accused Twitch of failing to remove a 31-second clip of a girl from the Ukrainian town of Bucha. The content of the video wasn't specified.

25.title: Carlo Ancelotti picks France and Brazil as 2022 World Cup favourites
25.article_body: Real Madrid manager Carlo Ancelotti has picked Brazil and defending champions France as his two favourite sides to win the 2022 FIFA World Cup. He added that Argentina were the other team to look out for because of Lionel Messi, while Spain, England and Germany were the dark horses. The tournament in Qatar will begin on November 20.

26.title: Never talked down to anyone: Bhogle as Ian Chappell retires from commentary
26.article_body: Talking about former Australia captain Ian Chappell retiring from commentary after 45 years, Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "Never pulled a punch, told it as it is, never talked down to anyone, wonderful professional & my role model for broadcasting work ethic." He added, "Was a privilege to work with him & I hope that proud voice is always heard."

27.title: 'Krrish 4' to introduce new characters: Reports
27.article_body: Hrithik Roshan's 'Krrish 4' will reportedly introduce new characters along with some new action sequences. As per reports, Rakesh Roshan is developing the script and is currently working on the crucial part of the story. The reports also claim that the new film will continue from where the third part of the superhero franchise ended.

28.title: Now it's cool: Kareena on notion that marriage ends actress' career
28.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan has shared that people no more think that a marriage can end an actress' career. She said they now feel "it's cool to be married". Recalling how she was warned about her career before marrying Saif Ali Khan, Kareena said she "wanted to get married at that point of time" and it was not planned.

29.title: Fintech unicorn Razorpay acquires POS machines provider Ezetap
29.article_body: Razorpay, the B2B payments aggregator and neo-banking platform, has acquired point-of-sale (POS) machines provider Ezetap in a mix of primary and secondary transactions. With 80% stake in the parent company of Ezetap, this is Razorpay's fifth acquisition in four years. According to regulatory filings, Bengaluru-based Ezetap's early investor, Helion Ventures still has minority stake in the company.

30.title: ABTYP to hold world's biggest blood donation drive on PM's birthday
30.article_body: Akhil Bhartiya Terapanth Yuvak Parishad (ABTYP) is planning the world's biggest blood donation drive for Prime Minister Narendra Modi's birthday on September 17. The Parishad's President Pankaj Daga said they plan to set up 1,000 camps across India aiming to collect three lakh units of blood. A BJP leader present at the event said the party would support the drive.

31.title: Maha govt announces singing of national anthem at 11 am on Wed
31.article_body: The Maharashtra government has announced a collective singing of the national anthem at 11 am on Wednesday (August 17) across the state. As per the government resolution, participation is mandatory for government and private schools, colleges, educational institutes, university teachers and students. Further, the government has appealed to everyone from the state to join the event.

32.title: What does the FIFA suspension mean for Indian football?
32.article_body: With FIFA suspending AIFF, all domestic leagues in India stand officially unrecognised. Indian men's football team's friendly matches against Vietnam and Singapore will be cancelled if suspension isn't revoked. FIFA said 2022 Under-17 Women’s World Cup "cannot be held in India as planned". Indian Women's League champions Gokulam Kerala might also be barred from AFC Women’s Club Championship.

33.title: Madras HC gives actor Vijay temporary relief in income tax case
33.article_body: The Madras High Court has temporarily stayed the Income Tax Department's orders imposing a ₹1.5 crore penalty on actor Vijay for not disclosing ₹15 crore income in his 2016-17 IT returns. The court agreed with Vijay's arguments that the punitive action was time-barred. The department imposed the penalty after conducting a raid at the actor's residence in 2020.

34.title: We'll have our own show 'Cutting with Kashyap', jokes Anurag
34.article_body: Taapsee Pannu and Anurag Kashyap have shared why they will not make an appearance on Koffee with Karan season 7, hosted by Karan Johar. Kashyap joked that he will make a budget-friendly show of his own called 'Cutting With Kashyap'. He also suggested 'Tharra With Taapsee' and 'Panna With Pannu' as the titles for Taapsee's talk show.

35.title: Kejriwal promises free, quality education in poll-bound Gujarat
35.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said quality education will be provided free of cost if the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) wins the assembly elections in Gujarat. The AAP convener vowed to improve the infrastructure of government schools and open new ones. In earlier visits to poll-bound Gujarat, Kejriwal announced pre-poll guarantees on electricity, unemployment allowance and women's welfare.

36.title: Crystal Palace defender gets death threats over Liverpool striker's red card
36.article_body: Crystal Palace defender Joachim Andersen said he received death threats after his altercation with Liverpool's Darwin Nunez led to the striker getting a red card. "Got maybe 300-400 of these messages last night...have some respect and stop (acting) tough online," said Andersen on Instagram. Liverpool were held to a 1-1 draw as Nunez was sent off for head-butting Andersen.

37.title: I still think about Hamilton's 2021 championship loss every day: Toto Wolff
37.article_body: Mercedes F1 boss Toto Wolff admitted he still thinks about last year's Abu Dhabi Grand Prix where Lewis Hamilton lost the world championship to Red Bull's Max Verstappen on the last lap. "I think about it every day. But I have my peace with Max winning," said Wolff. He added he was happy with the FIA's new President and transparency.

38.title: 18 foetuses found at municipal dumping ground in West Bengal's Howrah
38.article_body: Ragpickers scavenging through waste found at least 18 foetuses in a municipal dumping yard in West Bengal's Howrah district, 40 km west of Kolkata, police said on Tuesday. Local residents said there are at least 30 hospitals and nursing homes within the yard's two-km radius. "Foetuses have been sent for postmortem. An investigation is going on," a police officer said.

39.title: Law making period products free for all takes effect in Scotland
39.article_body: Scotland said it has become the world's first country to ensure period products are available free of charge to all persons who need them. Scotland's Period Products Act came into force on Monday. Under the law, colleges, schools and local government bodies must make period products, such as tampons and sanitary pads, available in their bathrooms free of cost.

40.title: We are going to miss him: Dhawan on Sundar being ruled out of Zimbabwe tour
40.article_body: Commenting on Washington Sundar being ruled out of India's tour of Zimbabwe due to a shoulder injury, India vice-captain Shikhar Dhawan said the team is going to miss the all-rounder. "At the same time, we've got a good backup as well," he added. Sundar has been replaced by 27-year-old all-rounder Shahbaz Ahmed. India-Zimbabwe will be playing three ODIs in Harare.

41.title: Stupid to ignore: England's Billings on Elgar questioning 'Bazball'
41.article_body: England wicketkeeper Sam Billings responded to South African batter Dean Elgar questioning the longevity of 'Bazball', saying, "You'd be pretty stupid to ignore that if I'm honest." He added that South Africa's defeat in the practice match should be a "wake-up call" as it wasn't even England's main XI. Elgar had said that 'Bazball' could "go south very quickly".

42.title: Looking forward to more work on OTT, but will never shut doors to TV: Drashti
42.article_body: Actress Drashti Dhami said she is glad that OTT has welcomed her so nicely and is looking forward to more work on the platform. She, however, added, "I can never shut my doors to TV, but right now, I'm just going with the flow." She further said, "In TV, we don't get to prepare for a role, here, we do."

43.title: Man walks into Assam police station with severed head
43.article_body: A man walked into a police station in Assam's Sonitpur district with a severed head, an official said on Tuesday. Tuniram Madri allegedly beheaded fellow villager Hem Ram after he lost a ₹500 bet on a local football match on Monday. Hem kept demanding the money and Tuniram killed him in a fit of rage, the official added.

44.title: 5 militants involved in IED blasts arrested in Manipur's Thoubal
44.article_body: Police said five militants of the banned outfit People's Liberation Army (PLA) involved in two Improvised Explosive Device (IED) blasts were arrested in Manipur's Thoubal district on Tuesday. A cordon and search operation was conducted at Tentha Tuwaband, during which three militants were arrested, Thoubal SP said. As a follow up operation, two more militants were also arrested, he added.

45.title: Assam woman realises flag in her closet is 90 yrs old, was used during freedom struggle
45.article_body: Assam's Kiron Rajhowa recently realised that the flag that has been in her possession for 40 years is 90 years old and was used during the freedom struggle by freedom fighter Podmeshwar Rajkhowa. Kiron's daughter-in-law Dolly realised the flag's heritage when it was given to Dolly's daughter. "We feel proud and privileged to have preserved this," Dolly said.

46.title: Gold worth ₹1.21 cr seized at Chennai airport from multiple incidents
46.article_body: Over two kg of gold worth ₹1.21 crore was seized from multiple incidents at the airport in Chennai, the Customs Department said on Tuesday. In one of the incidents, officials confiscated gold from a passenger who had concealed it in his rectum, the press release said. Electronic goods valued at ₹90,000 were recovered from all the incidents, the release added.

47.title: 'Uber charged ₹3,000 from Delhi airport to my house which was 45km away,' claims man
47.article_body: A Noida resident claimed that Uber charged him ₹2,935 for a cab from Delhi airport to his home, which was around 45 km away. "I was billed for 147.39 kms - halfway to Jaipur that I apparently covered in little over an hour!" he tweeted. "This, when...booking amount was ₹1,143. Pick-up and drop locations are inaccurate too!" the man added.

48.title: Tamil Nadu's DMK moves SC, challenges definition of 'freebies'
48.article_body: Tamil Nadu's ruling party DMK on Tuesday moved SC, challenging the definition of 'freebies'. The court is hearing a petition that has challenged the promise of freebies at election time, contending that the practice can bring financial ruin on a state. The DMK argued that free services are introduced with an intent to secure a "social order and economic justice".

49.title: 17-year-old Indian Grandmaster Praggnanandhaa defeats junior world number 1 Firouzja
49.article_body: India's 17-year-old Grandmaster Praggnanandhaa opened his campaign in the FTX Crypto Cup by defeating the junior world number one Alireza Firouzja. Praggnanandhaa won the four-game tie 2.5-1.5. He registered victories in the opening and the third game. He lost the second game, while the fourth game ended in a draw. He picked up three points for beating Firouzja.

50.title: Talaq-e-Hasan doesn't seem improper, women can opt for 'Khula' divorce: SC
50.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday observed that the Islamic practice of Talaq-e-Hasan, in which a man can divorce his wife by pronouncing 'talaq' once a month for three months, is "Prima Facie...not so improper". A two-judge bench said, "(In the practice,) women also have an option. 'Khula' is there." As per Islamic law, women can divorce their husbands through 'Khula'.

51.title: Adani Transmission becomes 15th Indian firm to cross ₹4 trillion in m-cap
51.article_body: Adani Transmission on Tuesday hit ₹4 trillion in market capitalisation for the first time after its shares rallied over 104% in 2022. It is the 15th Indian listed firm and the second Adani Group company to achieve this milestone. Adani Green Energy had become the first Adani Group company to reach ₹4 trillion in m-cap earlier this year.

52.title: PV Sindhu's coach Park Tae-sang leaves for Korea for back treatment
52.article_body: Indian shuttler PV Sindhu's coach Park Tae-sang has left for South Korea for back treatment. The 43-year-old revealed on Instagram that he had hurt his back during CWG 2022. "I'll get well treated and come back healthy. Stay healthy, everyone," he wrote. Earlier, Sindhu pulled out of Badminton World Championships due to a stress fracture on her foot.

53.title: Which 15 Indian companies have reached ₹4 trillion in m-cap?
53.article_body: Adani Transmission today became the 15th Indian company to reach ₹4 trillion in m-cap. It's the second Adani Group firm after Adani Green Energy to attain the milestone. Other Indian companies to reach ₹4 trillion in m-cap include Reliance Industries, TCS, HDFC Bank, Infosys, Hindustan Unilever, ICICI Bank, LIC, HDFC, SBI, Bajaj Finance, Bharti Airtel, Kotak Mahindra Bank and ITC.

54.title: Hope Team India can bank on me: Shahbaz after being picked for Zimbabwe tour
54.article_body: Reacting to his maiden India call-up in upcoming three-match ODI series against Zimbabwe, 27-year-old all-rounder Shahbaz Ahmed said, "Everybody who plays cricket wants to wear the India colours." He added, "Given a chance I hope I can win matches for India with my batting and bowling. I hope...team can bank on me." Shahbaz replaced Washington Sundar following his shoulder injury.

55.title: Top Malaysian court orders former PM Najib to begin final appeal
55.article_body: Malaysia's top court has ordered former PM Najib Razak to begin his final appeal in two days in the 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB) state fund scandal. The court rejected Najib's request for dismissal of his conviction and 12-year sentence over alleged judicial bias. Investigators have alleged that $4.5 billion was stolen from the 1MDB fund and laundered by Najib's associates.

56.title: 20-yr-old man dies after tree falls on him in UP's Firozabad
56.article_body: Police said that a 20-year-old aspirant preparing for a competitive examination, identified as Abhishek, died when a tree fell on him in Uttar Pradesh's Firozabad on Tuesday. The incident took place while the victim was returning from his coaching classes. The tree fell on Abhishek due to high-speed wind near Labhua village, SP (rural) Akhilesh Narayan said.

57.title: Flood situation in Madhya Pradesh under control: CM Shivraj Chouhan
57.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan has said that the flood situation in the state is currently under control. While assessing the flood situation, the CM said that due to excess rain, all dams in the Narmada catchment have been submerged. Talking about the state government's efforts, he added that many people were rescued from Vidisha and Balaghat districts.

58.title: Stale meat seized from Chennai mall's restaurants after surprise raid
58.article_body: After a surprise raid at multiple restaurants located inside a mall in Chennai's Anna Nagar, food safety authorities on Tuesday seized stale meat from a couple of them. "We received a complaint on Monday of poor quality food served at a restaurant here, in which a worm was found," said Dr Satheesh Kumar, who was leading the team of officials.

59.title: Losses from crypto hacks from Jan to Jul rose 60% YoY to $1.9 bn: Report
59.article_body: Losses arising from crypto hacks in 2022's first seven months jumped nearly 60% YoY to $1.9 billion, propelled by a surge in funds stolen from decentralised finance (DeFi) protocols, according to Chainalysis. In the same period last year, funds stolen from hacking amounted to $1.2 billion. "DeFi protocols are uniquely vulnerable to hacking," Chainalysis said in a blog post.

60.title: BJP doing double standard politics: Siddaramaiah on Shivamogga clashes
60.article_body: After communal clashes were reported in Karnataka's Shivamogga over the removal of Veer Savarkar's banner, Congress leader Siddaramaiah criticised BJP and accused it of being involved in double standard politics. "Why did they put Savarkar's photo in a Muslim area and remove Tipu Sultan's portrait?" Siddaramaiah questioned. "First BJP does all these things and blames Congress," Siddaramaiah added.

61.title: Mahagathbandhan formed out of selfish interests: Giriraj Singh
61.article_body: After the Bihar Cabinet expansion, Union Minister Giriraj Singh criticised the newly formed Mahagathbandhan and said this alliance is formed out of "selfish interests". "Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD in 2017. Now, for some reason or the other, he has gone back with RJD," Singh said. Nitish wishes to become a candidate for Prime Minister's post, Singh added.

62.title: Leave Kashmir or get killed: Kashmiri Pandit body to community
62.article_body: The Kashmiri Pandit Sangarash Samiti (KPSS) asked the community to leave the Valley after the targeted killing of a Kashmiri Pandit farmer by militants in Shopian. The KPSS President said that Pandits have "only one option- to leave Kashmir or get killed by religiously fanatic minds". He urged Kashmiri Pandits to move to safer places like Jammu and Delhi.

63.title: Bilkis rape convicts freed hrs after PM's women safety speech: Cong
63.article_body: Congress spokesman Pawan Khera on Tuesday said that hours after PM Narendra Modi spoke about women's safety and respect on Independence Day, Gujarat government released 11 people convicted in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case. "Who's the real Narendra Modi? The one who serves falsehood from...the Red Fort or the one who gets his Gujarat government to release [rapists]?" Khera asked.

64.title: London’s Heathrow Airport increases limit on number of daily flyers
64.article_body: Amid a shortage of staff, London's Heathrow Airport has extended its limit on the number of passengers flying out daily to cope with soaring demand from travellers. The airport said a maximum of 100,000 flyers can depart from its terminals each day till October 29. As per initial plans, the daily cap was expected to be lifted on September 11.

65.title: KL Rahul will gain a lot from Zimbabwe tour ahead of Asia Cup 2022: Dhawan
65.article_body: India vice-captain Shikhar Dhawan said KL Rahul will gain a lot from India's tour of Zimbabwe ahead of Asia Cup 2022. Rahul is returning to international cricket in the upcoming ODI series after not having played in any format of cricket following IPL 2022 due to fitness issues. Rahul will lead India in the three-match series in Harare, beginning Thursday.

66.title: Wanted Chinese online gambling operator arrested in Thailand
66.article_body: Thai police on Monday told Reuters that they had arrested a Chinese fugitive wanted by Beijing over allegations of running illegal online gambling operations. The process to extradite 40-year-old She Zhijiang to China is underway, police added. She Zhijiang was arrested last week based on an international warrant and an Interpol red notice, a police spokesperson informed.

67.title: Your heart breaks: Gaurav on his role being chopped in 'Bachchhan Paandey'
67.article_body: Actor Gaurav Chopraa opened up about his role being chopped in 'Bachchhan Paandey' and said, "Aapka dil thoda tutt ta hain (your heart breaks)...Didn’t know what to say about it." "There were a few things that I did jiske liye taaliyan baji set pe (that were applauded on the set)...you want that to reach the audience," he said.

68.title: 6 injured in clash in Assam's Lakhimpur; AASU stages road blockade
68.article_body: A group of miscreants allegedly attacked a Village Defence Party (VDP) in Assam's Lakhimpur district, injuring six VDP members in the area bordering Arunachal Pradesh. Following the incident, the All Assam Students' Union (AASU) staged a road blockade along the main highway leading to Arunachal Pradesh.

69.title: Not going to be easy: Maninder on Deepak Chahar's India comeback
69.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Maninder Singh said that the Indian team management should handle Deepak Chahar with care as it'll not be easy for the pacer to make a comeback in international cricket after returning from a hamstring injury. Chahar, who hasn't played since February 2022 due to injury, is named in India's 15-member squad for upcoming three-match ODI series against Zimbabwe.

70.title: All Tyagis aren't bad, I trust PM and Yogi: Woman abused by Shrikant
70.article_body: Days after a Noida woman was abused and pushed by alleged BJP member Shrikant Tyagi, the woman posted a video saying not all 'Tyagis' are bad and that she trusts PM Modi and Yogi Adityanath. "Aisa nahi hai ki saare BJP waale kharab hai," she said, adding that PM Modi and Yogi Adityanath have done wonders for the country.

71.title: Men plant bomb under Punjab Sub-Inspector's car, act caught on CCTV
71.article_body: Punjab Sub-Inspector Dilbag Singh on Tuesday said that a bomb was planted under his car in Amritsar. A CCTV footage showed two men arriving on a motorcycle and purportedly planting the bomb under the parked car. "I've worked during militancy...that is why they [planted the bomb]," Singh said. "Police recovered the IED...Further probe underway," Manish Chawla, IG Border Range, said.

72.title: Can’t let our guards down: Delhi L-G as COVID-19 cases rise again
72.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena has appealed to the people to 'not let their guards down' as the COVID-19 pandemic is "far from over". "We are witnessing a rise in COVID-19 infections...We cannot afford to let our guards down," tweeted Saxena. Delhi, on Monday, logged 1,227 fresh COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 14.57%.

73.title: Which Made-in-India weapons were handed over to the Indian Army today?
73.article_body: Several indigenously-developed defence systems and weapons were handed over by the Defence Minister to the Army, including the F-INSAS, the Nipun anti-personnel mines and the Landing Craft Assault (LCA). The F-INSAS (Future Infantry Soldier As A System) aims to increase the operational capability of a soldier. The LCA will be used as a replacement for boats in Ladakh's Pangong Tso.

74.title: Man who blackmailed Urfi Javed for cyber sex, threatened to cyber rape her arrested
74.article_body: Actress and 'Bigg Boss OTT' fame Urfi Javed on Tuesday said in an interview that the man who blackmailed her for cyber sex and threatened to cyber rape her has been arrested. She also took to Instagram Stories to share the picture of the man and thanked Mumbai Police. Urfi had alleged the man had been harassing her for years.

75.title: US needs conflicts to retain hegemony: Putin on Ukraine war
75.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday accused the US of encouraging extended hostilities in Ukraine so as to maintain its global hegemony. Putin said, "They need conflicts to retain their hegemony...That's why they have turned the Ukrainian people into cannon fodder." Putin was speaking at a security conference attended by representatives from Asia, Africa and Latin America.

76.title: BJP misusing paramilitary, police to transport money: Raj CM
76.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday accused BJP of misusing paramilitary and police forces to transport money to its party headquarters. "Even if a road is made of gold, just bring Hindu-Muslim angle during elections and win. They are in this arrogance, which will not last long," he said. "Pett roti maangta hai," CM Gehlot added.

77.title: 2019 corporate tax rate cut led to ₹1.84L cr revenue loss: Congress
77.article_body: Congress on Tuesday asked why the BJP government reduced the corporate tax rate from 30% to 22% in 2019. Quoting a Parliamentary estimates report, Congress spokesperson Gaurav Vallabh said the reduction led to a negative revenue impact of ₹1.84 lakh crore. "Why are such rate cuts limited to corporates, why the middle class is taxed at...30%," he asked.

78.title: Gemini North telescope captures image of 2 galaxies merging
78.article_body: The Gemini North telescope in Hawai'i captured a brilliant image of a pair of spiral galaxies, NGC 4568 and NGC 4567, merging into one another. Both the galaxies that are entangled in their mutual gravitational fields may eventually combine to form a single elliptical galaxy in around 500 million years. The cosmic collision took place approximately 60 million light-years away.

79.title: Malayalam actor Nedumbram Gopi dies at 85
79.article_body: Veteran Malayalam actor Nedumbram Gopi, 85, passed away on Tuesday due to age-related ailments. He made his acting debut with the award-winning film 'Kazhcha', which also starred Mammooty in the lead role. In the Blessy directorial, Nedumbram Gopi played the role of a father and a grandfather for which he received wide appreciation.

80.title: Delhi-bound Taj Express evacuated, searched after fake bomb threat
80.article_body: Passengers of the Delhi-bound Taj Express were asked to deboard at Mathura and the train was searched for two hours after a passenger received a bomb threat. Police said the caller claimed a bomb was placed in Taj Express' D2 coach and that it would explode when the train reached Delhi. A 45-year-old man has been arrested in the matter.

81.title: Akshay wishes Saif on b'day by dancing on 'Main Khiladi...' song
81.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar wished Saif Ali Khan on his birthday with a video wherein he can be seen performing on 'Main Khiladi Tu Anari' song, which he is recreating for his upcoming film 'Selfiee'. Sharing the video on Instagram, Akshay said the song "brings back fondest memories", especially of his "partner-in-crime" Saif. The original song starred Akshay and Saif.

82.title: Over 5,500 cases of discrimination reported in Germany in 2021
82.article_body: Germany's Anti-Discrimination Commissioner Ferda Ataman on Tuesday said 5,617 cases of discrimination were reported in the country in 2021, which was the second highest figure for a 12-month period since the agency's inception in 2006. Of all cases, 37% were connected to race and 32% were related to disability and diseases. "The number of discrimination cases...is alarming," Ataman said.

83.title: Savarkar's poster torn in K'taka's Tumakuru day after clashes in Shivamogga
83.article_body: A group of men allegedly tore down a banner that had a photo of Vinayak Damodar Savarkar in Karnataka's Tumakuru city on Tuesday. The incident comes a day after communal clashes were reported in Shivamogga district after another group removed a poster of Savarkar and put up one of Tipu Sultan on Independence Day.

84.title: Centre considering transfer of 4 Gujarat villages to UT of Dadra
84.article_body: The Union Home Ministry is holding discussions to transfer four villages and a piece of land from Gujarat to the Union Territory of Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu. Meghval, Nagar, Raymal and Madhuban villages in South Gujarat are more accessible from Diu. The Union Territory has demanded the land in Saurashtra to develop a fishing port.

85.title: Felt like a princess: Arjun Kanungo's wife Carla on mehndi outfit
85.article_body: South African model Carla Dennis, who recently got married to Indian singer Arjun Kanungo, chose to wear designer Anita Dongre's creation for her mehndi function. Describing her fuchsia pink outfit, Carla said, "I loved it the minute I saw it." She said she "felt like an absolute princess" in the lehenga. Carla and Arjun got married on August 10.

86.title: Sabotage behind ammunition depot blast in Crimea, says Russia
86.article_body: Russia has blamed saboteurs for the series of explosions that hit an ammunition depot in annexed Crimea on Tuesday. This comes as a rare admission by Russia that pro-Ukraine groups are damaging its military infrastructure in territories under its control. Notably, Kyiv had hinted at a possible Ukrainian involvement in explosions that rocked a Russian-operated airbase in Crimea last week.

87.title: 2 men detained over murder of CPI(M) worker in Kerala's Palakkad
87.article_body: Two men have been detained in connection with the murder of 40-year-old CPI(M) worker K Shajahan in Kerala's Palakkad district. "We have...got a definite lead about six others who directly participated in the crime," Palakkad SP R Viswanadh said. "The real motive behind the crime can be established only after a detailed investigation," the SP added.

88.title: US First Lady Jill Biden tests positive for COVID-19
88.article_body: US First Lady Jill Biden tested positive for COVID-19 after developing cold-like symptoms late on Monday evening, her communications director Elizabeth Alexander said on Tuesday. After testing negative earlier on Monday as part of her regular testing cadence, a PCR test taken after she developed symptoms came back positive. She is only experiencing mild symptoms.

89.title: Tencent stops sales on its NFT platform Huanhe a year after launch
89.article_body: Tencent on Tuesday announced that its non-fungible token (NFT) platform Huanhe will no longer release digital collectibles. Tencent said users of Huanhe, launched in August 2021, will still be able to hold, display or request for refund of their existing collectibles. Huanhe is making adjustments to its business based on its consideration to focus on its core strategy, Tencent said.

90.title: Restoration underway after Lucknow's Bara Imambara dome collapses
90.article_body: The restoration work on the dome of Lucknow's Bara Imambara, which collapsed on Monday evening, is currently underway. An Archaeological Survey of India official said that the work on the small structure will be completed in a day or two. The dome collapsed due to heavy rainfall and wind around 6 pm on Monday.

91.title: 'Vulgar' songs played in IIT-BHU after flag hoisting, probe ordered
91.article_body: 'Vulgar' Bhojpuri songs were allegedly played after the Independence Day flag hoisting ceremony at the Indian Institute of Technology- Banaras Hindu University (IIT-BHU). The administration has ordered a probe into the incident. An official said that after the ceremony, some youths played 'vulgar' Bhojpuri songs and danced before the staff paused the music and asked that the venue be evacuated.

92.title: Anurag Kashyap shares pic with ex-wives Kalki Koechlin & Aarti Bajaj, says 'My 2 pillars'
92.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap took to Instagram on Tuesday to share a picture with his ex-wives Kalki Koechlin and Aarti Bajaj. "My two pillars," he wrote in the caption of the post. While Anurag and Aarti were married from 1997 to 2009, the director and Kalki were married from 2011 and 2015. "Iconic," commented Aaliyah Kashyap, Anurag's daughter with Aarti.

93.title: It hurt him, really tore him to shreds: Karthik on Rohit being dropped from Tests in 2018
93.article_body: Recalling the time when Rohit Sharma was dropped from India's Test squad for England tour in 2018, wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said, "He was sent back after the white-ball leg and that really hurt him." "Rohit did not see that coming and that really tore him to shreds," the 37-year-old added.

94.title: Drunk guard caught molesting girls at Delhi hostel, CCTV footage emerges
94.article_body: An intoxicated security guard molested and thrashed girls at a PG hostel in Delhi's Karol Bagh, Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) chief Swati Maliwal said on Tuesday. She also shared CCTV footage of the alleged incident where the guard is seen molesting a girl who is seen resisting. DCW has issued a notice to police, Maliwal said.

95.title: Zimbabwe playing good cricket, will keep us on our toes: Dhawan ahead of 1st ODI
95.article_body: Ahead of the first India-Zimbabwe ODI in Harare, India vice-captain Shikhar Dhawan said the hosts are playing good cricket and it will keep the visitors on their toes. "We would not take anything for granted. We are here to perform," he added. First ODI will be played on Thursday. Zimbabwe won the recently concluded three-match ODI series against Bangladesh 2-1.

96.title: 30% shows of 'Laal...' & 'Raksha Bandhan' cancelled due to no audience
96.article_body: Around 30% of the morning shows of 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and 'Raksha Bandhan' were reportedly cancelled by the exhibitors across the country on Tuesday due to no audience. "It's a dark black weekend," an exhibitor said as quoted by Bollywood Hungama, "Both Aamir Khan and Akshay Kumar have to introspect on their choices of films," the exhibitor added.

97.title: Mandla is India's first functionally literate district: MP Minister
97.article_body: Madhya Pradesh's tribal-dominated Mandla has become India's first "functionally literate" district, declared state minister Bisahulal Singh. The District Collector said it was the result of a campaign launched after locals complained of being defrauded due to illiteracy. A person can be called functionally literate when they are able to write their own name, count, read and write in Hindi.

98.title: 3 techies, cab driver returning from Udaipur trip die in car crash
98.article_body: Three techies, who visited Udaipur for a trip, died while returning after a speeding truck struck their cab in Gurugram on Tuesday. The 35-year-old cab driver from Noida also died in the crash. One of the deceased's friends, who was also in the vehicle, has sustained multiple injuries, police said. The truck lost control and overturned on the victims' vehicle.

99.title: If I lose 2,000 points, I'll start again: US Open defending champ Raducanu
99.article_body: Speaking about the pressure of having to defend 2,000 ranking points at upcoming US Open, defending champion Emma Raducanu said, "If I lose 2,000 points so be it, I'll start again from the bottom." She added, "I know I can do something that no one else has done. I qualified and won...US Open, so I can start from the beginning."

100.title: PETA seeks to ban dog breeding for illegal fighting in UP
100.article_body: The People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals (PETA) India has asked to ban the keeping, breeding and sale of dogs for illegal fighting in Uttar Pradesh. PETA has also asked that illegal pet shops and breeders be shut down. According to the organisation, the ban can be achieved by owners mandatorily sterilising the breeds placed on the prohibited list.

101.title: Shameful: Anupam Kher on Kashmiri Pandit man's killing
101.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher condemned the killing of a Kashmiri Pandit man by terrorists in Kashmir's Shopian and said, "(It's) shameful that atrocities on Kashmiri Pandits continue...They're killing their own people." He added that terrorists were "killing everyone who stands with India". Kher said the more the actions were condemned, "the less it is" and that mindset needs to be changed.

102.title: Bollywood stars should reduce fee for focus on good cinema: BJP
102.article_body: Responding to reports of several Hindi films underperforming at the box office, BJP's Syed Zafar Islam on Tuesday said that Bollywood stars should reduce their fee to allow producers to focus on good cinema. "Remember, OTT is a better and cost-effective option available to people", he said, adding that the full industry is going through a lean phase post-COVID-19.

103.title: Air India announces launch of direct flight between Pune & Ahmedabad
103.article_body: Air India has announced the launch of direct flight between Pune and Ahmedabad with effect from August 20, 2022, to cater to the growing demand for air connectivity between the smart cities. "This new addition is set to improve Air India's domestic connectivity and empower our customers with more travel options," MD and CEO of Air India Campbell Wilson stated.

104.title: 6-yr-old raped & murdered in Haryana's Panipat, migrant worker held
104.article_body: A 40-year-old migrant worker was arrested on Tuesday for allegedly raping and murdering a six-year-old girl in Haryana's Panipat. Police said the accused hailed from Uttarakhand's Chamoli and was living in Panipat for 15 years. The accused said he lured the girl on the pretext of buying her biscuits while she was playing and took her to a deserted place.

105.title: Rhine's low water levels threatening industry: German lobby group
105.article_body: Amid drought in Europe, Germany's main industry lobby group on Tuesday said that factories may have to slow down production or cease it completely as Rhine river's dwindling water levels are hampering transportation of cargo. Lobby group BDI further said that transporting cargo through other means was difficult due to limited rail capacity and a lack of drivers.

106.title: Serena Williams is one of the greatest athletes, male or female: McEnroe
106.article_body: Praising Serena Williams, ex-world number one John McEnroe said the 23-time Grand Slam champion, for him, is the greatest female athlete in the history of sports. "I don't care who you could come up with. She's one of the greatest athletes period, male or female," he added. The 40-year-old will be retiring after the US Open 2022.

107.title: Plane from India with 12 people lands in Pak for unknown reason: Report
107.article_body: A charter airplane carrying 12 passengers from India landed at Pakistan's Jinnah International Airport in Karachi on August 15, Geo News reported. The flight took off shortly after arriving in Karachi, with 12 passengers on board. Confirming the incident, a Civil Aviation Authority spokesperson said the flight had no connection with Pakistan. It's unclear why it had landed in Karachi.

108.title: New study reveals when the Sun is estimated to die
108.article_body: The Sun at the centre of our solar system is "currently in its comfortable middle age", new data from the European Space Agency's (ESA) GAIA spacecraft has said. The current age of the Sun is estimated to be 4.57 billion years, data showed. It will die after becoming a red giant star when it's around 10-11 billion years old.

109.title: Doesn't seem Dalit boy was thrashed for touching water pot: Raj Police
109.article_body: The nine-year-old Dalit boy, who died after he was beaten up at his school in Rajasthan, doesn't appear to have been thrashed for touching his teacher's drinking water pot, Jalore SP HV Agarwalla said. "Most of the students in the school are from SC/ST communities and so is half the staff," said Jogeshwar Garg, BJP MLA from Jalore.

110.title: 40-yr-old Ghaziabad builder cheats 31 investors of over ₹10 cr, held
110.article_body: A 40-year-old man was arrested from West Delhi by officers of the Economic Offences Wing of the Delhi Police last week, for allegedly cheating 31 investors of over ₹10 crore, police said on Tuesday. The accused's company took money from people for shops and flats at a plot in Haryana but escaped after promising possession within 27 months to investors.

111.title: 1,100 Rohingya refugees living in Delhi tents to be shifted to flats
111.article_body: Around 1,100 Rohingya refugees, currently residing in tents in Delhi's Madanpur Khadar area,  will be shifted into New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) flats, officials said on Tuesday. The decision was taken at a meeting chaired by Chief Secretary of Delhi Naresh Kumar. The flats, located in Bakkarwala village, will be equipped with basic amenities and round-the-clock security, officials said.

112.title: Rohit asked to go inside restaurant after massive crowd gathers to see him, video viral
112.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing a massive crowd gathering outside a restaurant in Mumbai to get a glimpse of Team India captain Rohit Sharma. In the video, Rohit can be seen exiting the restaurant and being immediately asked by the security personnel to go inside due to the amount of people blocking the road.

113.title: Nitish betrayed Tejashwi Yadav too: Sushil Modi after cabinet expansion
113.article_body: After the cabinet expansion of the newly formed Mahagathbandhan government in Bihar, BJP Rajya Sabha MP Sushil Kumar Modi said Nitish Kumar has betrayed Tejashwi Yadav by keeping Home and Finance portfolios with the JD(U). "What message does Nitish Kumar want to give by keeping people like Surendra Yadav, Ramanand Yadav and Lalit Yadav in the cabinet," Sushil Modi tweeted.

114.title: Around 600 Chinese manjha rolls seized in Delhi, 5 shopkeepers held
114.article_body: Five men were arrested by Northeast Delhi Police Saturday, for allegedly possessing and selling nearly 600 rolls of banned Chinese manjha in the Jafrabad and Bhajanpura areas. One of the accused reportedly confessed that he had been collecting the manjha rolls from his sources for some time so that he could sell them at a higher rate on Independence Day.

115.title: Liquor shop cashier hacked to death in TN; incident caught on camera
115.article_body: A video showing a group of miscreants murdering a state-owned liquor store's cashier on Monday in Tamil Nadu's Sirumugai has surfaced online. According to reports, many men holding machetes and knives stormed the wine store where the victim worked. The video shows approximately six assailants attacking the victim with sharp-edged instruments, who then allegedly hacked him to death.

116.title: Delhi court acquits man from charges of possessing heroin, liquor
116.article_body: A Delhi court has acquitted a man, accused of carrying illicit liquor and possessing heroin, saying there were "major contradictions" in the deposition of the prosecution witnesses. Special Judge Deepak Wason, in an order, also said that the police showed "deliberate disregard" of the statutory procedures during its probe and gave the accused benefit of the doubt.

117.title: Drugs worth ₹1,026 cr seized after Mumbai Police busts mephedrone unit
117.article_body: Mumbai Police have busted a mephedrone, or MD, manufacturing unit in Gujarat and seized 513 kg of the synthetic drug worth ₹1,026 crore, an official said on Tuesday. The Anti-Narcotics Cell also arrested Giriraj Dixit, the owner of the drug unit who holds a master's degree in Chemistry. The unit was raided on August 13 and was located in Ankleshwar.

118.title: 2 killed as truck hits bike in Uttar Pradesh's Budaun
118.article_body: Two people were killed when a light-duty truck hit a motorcycle in Uttar Pradesh's Budaun, police said on Tuesday. According to the police, the accident took place late on Monday night near Lahra village. The deceased were identified as 50-year-old Chandrapal Shakya and 30-year-old Avnish Yadav, both residents of Dhakpura village, Station House Officer Ram Avtar Singh said.

119.title: NIA court sends JMI student with ISIS links to 30-day custody
119.article_body: An NIA court on Tuesday sent Mohsin Ahmad, a student of Jamia Millia Islamia and an active ISIS member, to judicial custody for 30 days. "Ahmad is a radicalised and active member of ISIS. He has been arrested for his involvement in the collection of funds for ISIS from sympathisers in India as well as abroad," the NIA statement said.

120.title: Raju Srivastava still on ventilator, condition slowly improving: Manager
120.article_body: Raju Srivastava is still on ventilator, but his condition is improving slowly, the comedian's Business Manager, Nayan Soni, said. "There's an improvement in his health...he can now move his body parts a bit," Nayan said. "Doctors have informed...it'll take about a week for him to regain consciousness," he added. Raju is undergoing treatment at AIIMS, Delhi, following a heart attack.

121.title: Take strict action: NCPCR to Rajasthan govt over Dalit boy's death
121.article_body: Apex child rights body NCPCR has sought strict action by the Rajasthan government against those responsible for allegedly beating a Dalit boy to death for touching a drinking water pot. Police have arrested the boy's 40-year-old teacher. NCPCR, in a letter to Jalore district magistrate, sought copies of the FIR and action taken against the accused within seven days.

122.title: 'The Dirty Picture' sequel in pipeline, won't feature Vidya Balan: Reports
122.article_body: As per reports, producer Ekta Kapoor is planning a sequel to 'The Dirty Picture', one of the biggest Bollywood blockbusters. The sequel of the film, which originally featured actress Vidya Balan as Silk Smitha, is expected to have a completely different plotline with different actors. The makers are reportedly considering Kriti Sanon and Taapsee Pannu for the movie.

123.title: Farah Khan has made me the personality I am today: Geeta Kapur
123.article_body: Choreographer Geeta Kapur, who started her career in Bollywood by joining choreographer Farah Khan's troupe at 15, said Farah has played an important role in helping her make a mark in the industry. "Different people have been crucial in making a difference at every stage of my career, but working with...Farah...has made me the personality I am today," she said.

124.title: Mob lynches vegetable vendor in Raj on suspicion of stealing tractor
124.article_body: A 45-year-old vegetable vendor in Rajasthan's Alwar, who was allegedly lynched by a mob on Monday, succumbed to his injuries while undergoing treatment in a hospital in Jaipur, police said. The deceased was lynched by over a dozen people on the suspicion of stealing a tractor. The deceased was heading home after relieving himself when the incident took place.

125.title: FIR filed in Delhi after video showed Bobby Kataria smoking in plane
125.article_body: Delhi Police on Monday registered an FIR against social media influencer Bobby Kataria for allegedly violating security and safety measures by smoking inside a purported SpiceJet plane. This comes days after a video showed Kataria lighting a cigarette and smoking inside an aircraft. FIR has been filed on the basis of a complaint by SpiceJet's Legal and Company Affairs Manager.

126.title: Port won't be used for military goals: SL Prez amid Indian concerns on China 'spy' ship
126.article_body: Amid India's concerns over a Chinese 'spy' ship in Sri Lanka's Hambantota port, Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe said, "We don't want Hambantota to be used for military purposes." In an interview two days before the ship docked, Wickremesinghe added, "The present ship (China's Yuan Wang 5) didn't come under [military category]. [It] came under the category of a research ship."

127.title: Expectations from him are very high: Anjum on why Pant faces criticism
127.article_body: Commenting on why Rishabh Pant faces criticism when he doesn't perform, ex-India Women captain Anjum Chopra said it's because the India wicketkeeper-batter is constantly coming up with match-winning performances and expectations from him are very high. "He has set a benchmark for himself since his debut in international cricket," she added. Pant made his India debut in February 2017.

128.title: China's Tencent plans to divest Meituan stake worth $24 billion: Report
128.article_body: Tencent plans to sell all or a bulk of its $24 billion stake in food delivery firm Meituan to monetise their eight-year-old investment, Reuters reported. Tencent is seeking to execute the sale within this year, if market conditions are favourable. Value of Tencent's shareholdings in companies has dropped from $201 billion in end-March 2021 to $89 billion in end-March 2022.

129.title: Suffering from complex mental health issues, want to apologise for past behaviour: Miller
129.article_body: Actor Ezra Miller has issued a statement amid several legal issues. "Having recently gone through a time of intense crisis, I now understand that I'm suffering complex mental health issues and have begun ongoing treatment," Miller said in a statement to Variety. "I want to apologise to everyone that I have alarmed and upset with my past behaviour," Miller added.

130.title: Video shows men touching feet of Bilkis Bano gangrape convicts, feeding them sweets
130.article_body: A video of the 11 men, who were sentenced to life imprisonment in Bilkis Bano gangrape case, walking free and being felicitated has surfaced. The video showed that their relatives touched their feet and offered them sweets. The men were found guilty of raping Bilkis while she was pregnant and murdering seven members of her family including her three-year-old daughter.

131.title: NIA court sends alleged ISIS member to 30-day judicial custody
131.article_body: A National Investigation Agency (NIA) court has sent an alleged active member of ISIS, Mohsin Ahmad, to judicial custody for 30 days. He was arrested by the agency on August 6 from his Delhi residence for his alleged involvement in the collection of funds for ISIS from sympathisers in India and sending it to other countries in form of cryptocurrency.

132.title: SC to hear Unnao rape survivor’s plea for transfer of case
132.article_body: Supreme Court has agreed to hear the plea filed by Unnao rape survivor seeking transfer of a criminal case from UP to Delhi. The victim claimed that a non-bailable warrant was issued against her after an FIR was filed by the father of one of the perpetrators. She added that there was a grave threat to her life in Unnao.

133.title: Man’s body made to float on tube to cross flooded river in MP by villagers
133.article_body: A man’s body was allegedly tied to floating rubber tube by some villagers in MP to cross flooded Narmada river, between Dindori and Anuppur and make it reach its village for last rites following closure of connecting road. A local administration official said they would probe the matter, after video of some people carrying the body surfaced on social media

134.title: History-sheeter shot dead outside district court in UP's Hapur
134.article_body: A history-sheeter was shot dead by unidentified assailants outside the district and sessions court in UP's Hapur, police said on Tuesday. Lakhan(35), the deceased, was brought from Haryana's Faridabad jail in connection with a case registered against him at Hapur's Dhaulana police station. Examination of CCTV footage of the incident is underway and shooters will be identified soon, police added.

135.title: Factory manufacturing fake black pepper busted in UP, 4 arrested
135.article_body: Police said a factory manufacturing fake black pepper was busted in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur and four people were arrested on Tuesday. Eight quintals of fake black pepper, 25 quintals of ingredients and chemicals were found, SP (City) Sanjay Kumar said. The factory owner said he used to sell the adulterated spices to wholesalers at the rate of ₹250 per kilogram.

136.title: Made in India defence system F-INSAS handed over to Indian Army
136.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Tuesday handed over the Future Infantry Soldier As A System (F-INSAS) to the Indian Army. With a range of 300 metres, the weapon system is the first and only Made in India weapon of the 21 series. F-INSAS soldiers are provided with elbow and knee pads, ballistic helmet, goggles, bulletproof jacket, and night vision devices.

137.title: New Zealand A to tour India in August-September, Aus A visit likely in Nov
137.article_body: New Zealand A is reportedly set to tour India in August-September for three four-day games and as many List A matches. According to a report, BCCI is also in negotiations with Cricket Australia for a tour in November. This will be India A's first assignment since their tour to South Africa prior to the national team's three-Test series in December.

138.title: What about past promises: KT Rama Rao on PM Modi's I-Day speech
138.article_body: After PM Narendra Modi set five resolves for the country during his Independence Day speech, Telangana minister KT Rama Rao asked as to what happened to his past promises. "Where is...accountability if you don't even acknowledge your own targets & subsequent failures in accomplishing the same?" KTR tweeted. He shared reports of PM talking about doubling farmers' income by 2022.

139.title: Proposed Aqua Hub in Mid Manair Dam will provide 10,000 jobs: KTR
139.article_body: Telangana Municipal Administration and Urban Development (MAUD) Minister KT Rama Rao on Monday said establishing the proposed Aqua Hub in Mid Manair Dam would ensure employment for 10,000 people. "An MoU has been signed with a US-based fish organisation to set up the country's biggest Aqua Hub in...Mid Manair Dam," KTR said, adding this would be a game-changer for fisheries.

140.title: UP Cabinet approves setting up of eco-tourism development board
140.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Cabinet on Tuesday approved setting up of an eco-tourism development board to fully utilise the state's tourism potential. The board will be headed by Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath with ministers of 10 departments as its members, Tourism Minister Jaiveer Singh said. He added that the board will help the state attract domestic and international tourists.

141.title: Before aunties & uncles used to troll, now social media: Vijay Deverakonda
141.article_body: Responding to a question about social media trolls during the promotions of his upcoming film 'Liger', actor Vijay Deverakonda said, "[Trolling] is common, it's an everyday thing." He added, "Even before I became an actor, aunties and uncles used to troll about results, college, job etc...now it's social media trolling." "Be it anything, trolling is always there," Vijay said.

142.title: Got to know of convicts' release through media: Bilkis Bano's husband
142.article_body: A day after all 11 convicts sentenced to life imprisonment for Bilkis Bano's gang-rape walked out of jail, her husband said he came to know of their release through media. "We don't know when the convicts processed their application and which ruling...state government took into consideration," Bano's husband Yakub Rasul said. The convicts were released under Gujarat government's remission policy.

143.title: Family finds human remains in suitcases bought at an auction in New Zealand
143.article_body: A family in New Zealand's Auckland found human remains in suitcases they purchased at a storage unit auction, police said. The family called the police after finding the remains that they unknowingly brought home. Reports said that police could be dealing with remains from multiple human bodies and a homicide investigation has been launched.

144.title: Started happening a lot, it's unfair: Arjun on people boycotting B'wood films
144.article_body: While talking about people boycotting Bollywood films, actor Arjun Kapoor said that it has started happening a lot now and that it is unfair. "I think we made a mistake by being silent...that was our decency but people have started taking advantage of that...I guess we tolerated it a lot and now people have made this a habit," he added.

145.title: Doubtful Dalit boy beaten for touching water pot of upper-caste people: Raj MLA
145.article_body: BJP MLA from Rajasthan's Jalore Jogeshwar Garg has said that he talked to villagers and there is "doubt" that the nine-year-old Dalit boy, who died after being allegedly beaten by his teacher, was thrashed because he touched a water pot used by upper-caste people. He, however, added that there's "no doubt that the boy was beaten up by the teacher".

146.title: We're playing nice cricket, but haven't given ours a name: Boucher on 'Bazball'
146.article_body: Referring to England's attacking style of cricket being called 'Bazball', South Africa head coach Mark Boucher said, "We've not given ours a name. [But] we believe we've been playing a nice brand of cricket." Boucher added, "We want to play aggressive cricket but you have to be smart." South Africa's three-match Test series against England will begin on August 17.

147.title: US stoking tensions in Asia with Pelosi's visit, AUKUS: Putin
147.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin described US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's Taiwan visit as a ''thoroughly planned provocation'' and accused the US of stoking tensions in Asia. While speaking at a Moscow security conference, Putin said AUKUS is evidence of the West's attempts to build a NATO-style bloc in the Asia-Pacific region. Putin called AUKUS an aggressive military-political alliance.

148.title: Declared Arjun Reddy a blockbuster when I released it, felt it was one: Vijay
148.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda said that he declares some of his movies blockbusters even before he starts promoting them. He said that his upcoming movie 'Liger' is one of them. He also said that he had also declared 'Arjun Reddy' a blockbuster when he released the movie but that he also felt pressure of saying it out loud.

149.title: Estonia removes Soviet-era tank monument amid Ukraine-Russia war
149.article_body: Amid the ongoing Ukraine-Russia war, Estonia has said it'll remove a Soviet-era tank monument from public space in Narva, a town with large Russian-speaking population. "No one wants to see our militant and hostile neighbour foment tensions in our home," Estonia's PM Kaja Kallas said, adding, "We'll not afford Russia the opportunity to use the past to disturb...peace in Estonia."

150.title: When I travel, I carry books for competitive exams: CWG medallist Sreeshankar
150.article_body: India's first male athlete to win a silver in the long jump at CWG, Murali Sreeshankar has revealed that he carries "a lot of books" when he travels as he's preparing for competitive exams. He added, "I hope some organisation offers me a job as it's very important to have job security." Sreeshankar bagged silver at the 2022 CWG.

151.title: French forces stationed in Mali since 2013 leave the country
151.article_body: French forces battling Islamist militants in Mali since 2013 left the country on Monday, France's Defence Ministry informed. The decision to withdraw troops was taken by France in February over deteriorating relations with Mali. France and its military allies have said that Niger will become the new hub of operations for their forces battling Islamist militants in the Sahel region.

152.title: Shah Rukh Khan-owned Abu Dhabi Knight Riders announce their 1st ever squad
152.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan-owned Abu Dhabi Knight Riders (ADKR) on Tuesday announced their first-ever squad for the UAE's inaugural International League T20 season. Sunil Narine and Andre Russell, who represent KKR in IPL, have been included in the ADKR squad. The squad also includes Jonny Bairstow, Lahiru Kumara, Charith Asalanka, Colin Ingram and Ravi Rampaul, among others.

153.title: Kevin O'Brien, who hit the fastest-ever World Cup ton, retires from international cricket
153.article_body: Ireland all-rounder Kevin O'Brien on Tuesday announced his retirement from international cricket aged 38. O'Brien, who holds the record for the fastest-ever ODI World Cup hundred, said, "I had hoped to finish...career at...T20 World Cup in Australia but having not been picked for the Irish squad since last year's World Cup...I feel the selectors and management are looking elsewhere."

154.title: ICC reveals first-ever women's Future Tours Program
154.article_body: The ICC on Tuesday announced the first-ever women's Future Tours Program (FTP). The FTP includes the international obligations for all the sides until the end of April in 2025, leading up to the women's World Cup in India. There will be 301 international women's matches played during the next period, featuring seven Test matches, 135 ODIs and 159 T20Is.

155.title: Explosions hit Crimean village, Russian representative says 2 injured
155.article_body: An ammunition depot in Russia-annexed region of Crimea witnessed explosions on Tuesday. A Russian representative in the region said two people were wounded, railway traffic had been halted and about 2,000 people in a nearby village were evacuated. "Crimea occupied by Russians is about warehouse explosions and high risk of death for invaders and thieves," Ukrainian presidential advisor tweeted.

156.title: Some of our leaders instigating party workers: Rajasthan CM Gehlot
156.article_body: In a veiled attack on Rajasthan's former Deputy CM Sachin Pilot, Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot said some party leaders are instigating workers by telling them that they are not being treated with respect. "Have you ever honoured and respected...workers? Do you even know what honour and respect [are]?" Gehlot said. His remarks came while addressing a programme at Shaheed Memorial.

157.title: No money is lost: 'Laal Singh...' makers on reports of distributors demanding compensation
157.article_body: Ajit Andhare, CEO of Viacom 18 Studios, has denied reports of some distributors demanding compensation for the performance of 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "There are no external distributors...and no money is lost in...first place. Film is still running in theatres both in India and internationally. This is baseless speculation," he told ETimes. The film has earned ₹45.83 crore so far.

158.title: Very unfortunate that FIFA has banned Indian football: Bhaichung Bhutia
158.article_body: Reacting to FIFA suspending All India Football Federation (AIFF), former India captain Bhaichung Bhutia said, "Very unfortunate that FIFA has banned Indian football...I feel it's a very harsh decision of FIFA to ban Indian football." He added, "But at the same time I feel it's a great opportunity for us to get our system right."

159.title: I rank 'RRR' below 'Makkhi' and a lot of other films: Anurag Kashyap
159.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap said he'd rank SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' below 'Baahubali', 'Makkhi' as well as a "lot of other" films. "When you're building a mythology...it's not...sticking," added Kashyap. "I didn't enjoy 'RRR' as much as 'Pushpa'," he stated. However, Kashyap believes 'RRR' is among films that can be India's entry for Oscars, adding he hopes 'The Kashmir Files' isn't picked.

160.title: Terrorists responsible won't be spared: J&K LG on killing of Kashmiri Pandit
160.article_body: J&K LG Manoj Sinha on Tuesday condemned the incident where a Kashmiri Pandit was killed and his brother got injured in Shopian after terrorists fired upon civilians. "The attack deserves the strongest condemnation from everyone. Terrorists responsible for the barbaric act will not be spared," the Office of LG J&K tweeted. "Pained beyond words on despicable terror attack," tweet read.

161.title: California-based startup Fictiv opens its first office in India in Pune
161.article_body: California-based startup Fictiv is opening its first office in India in Pune. Fictiv helps other startups create products with an easy-to-use platform as it supports a network of manufacturing partners and innovators around the world. Fictiv started hiring last year for Pune and currently has 30 employees in the city, and the company said future hires are in the pipeline.

162.title: Asteroids may have brought water to Earth billions of years ago: Study
162.article_body: Asteroids might have brought water to the Earth billions of years ago, a Japanese study that analysed rare samples brought back to the planet from the asteroid Ryugu stated. "Volatile and organic-rich C-type asteroids may have been one of the main sources of Earth's water," the study stated. "The delivery of volatiles to...Earth is still a subject of...debate," it added.

163.title: Pune's CGST & Customs chief hoists National Flag to mark 76th I-Day
163.article_body: The CGST & Customs, Pune Zone tweeted on Monday that the agency's Chief Commissioner SM Tata hoisted the National Flag amid celebrations to mark India's 76th Independence Day. It added that Tata also felicitated the specially-abled employees of Terrasinne, which is Pune's first conscious dining restaurant and from where the refreshments for the event were obtained.

164.title: Told composers 'Don't release Sidhu's songs' as people would've misused: Gippy
164.article_body: Punjabi singer Gippy Grewal revealed the reason why he told music composers to not release Sidhu Moosewala's unfinished or finished songs after the latter's death. "People would've misused them," he said. He added that Sidhu's songs are only property his parents are left with. "Even after his death, a couple of his songs got released...we don't know how," he stated.

165.title: Air India to use Meta's Workplace for communication with employees
165.article_body: To communicate with its 11,000 plus employees, Air India will use Meta's digital platform called Workplace. This will give the "employees a platform that promotes more open communication and information sharing within and across all levels of the organisation", the airline said. It will help Air India's employees get regular and real-time updates on the airline's operations and future plans.

166.title: 1,900 Signal users' phone numbers exposed in Twilio hack
166.article_body: End-to-end encrypted messaging platform Signal has said that phone numbers and SMS verification codes of 1,900 users may have been revealed in a phishing attack on Twilio Inc, earlier this month. However, it said message history, profile information and contact lists were not revealed. Twilio disclosed the phishing attack on August 7 through a blogpost.

167.title: Wild elephant dies due to mouth injury near TN-Kerala border area
167.article_body: An ailing wild elephant, who was suffering from a mouth injury for the last four days, died on Tuesday afternoon, as per ANI report. The elephant used to live in Attappadi and Anaikatti areas at the Tamil Nadu-Kerala border. As per the report, the elephant was not eating for the past several days due to injury.

168.title: TN CM Stalin announces 3% hike in DA for govt employees, pensioners
168.article_body: While addressing the public on Independence Day, Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin announced a 3% hike in the dearness allowance (DA) for state government employees and pensioners. This would benefit over 16 lakh people and is expected to cost the exchequer around ₹1947.6 crore. Freedom fighters' monthly pension has been increased from ₹18,000 to ₹20,000 from August 15, Stalin added.

169.title: Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha' earns ₹46.25 crore in 5 days
169.article_body: Aamir Khan and Kareena Kapoor Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha' earned ₹8.50 crore on Monday, bringing the domestic box office collection to ₹46.25 crore in five days. The film collected ₹9 crore and ₹10 crore on Saturday and Sunday, respectively. 'Laal Singh Chaddha' also features Mona Singh and Naga Chaitanya. It is an official remake of Tom Hanks-starrer 'Forrest Gump'.

170.title: Another example of PM Modi govt's failure: Owaisi on killing of Kashmiri Pandit
170.article_body: Condemning the incident where a Kashmiri Pandit was killed and his brother got injured in Shopian after terrorists fired upon civilians, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said, "This is another example of the failure of the [PM] Modi government." "The responsibility for the failure to safeguard the lives of Kashmiri Pandits in J&K lies on BJP and its government," he added.

171.title: There's no need to use nuclear weapons in Ukraine: Russia amid speculations
171.article_body: Russian defence minister Sergei Shoigu has said that there is "no need" to use nuclear weapons in Ukraine. He further described media speculation that Russia might deploy nuclear or chemical weapons against Ukraine as "absolute lies". "The main purpose of Russian nuclear weapons is to deter a nuclear attack," Shoigu stated.

172.title: Ratan Tata invests in startup founded by his business assistant for senior citizens
172.article_body: Ratan Tata has invested an undisclosed amount into Goodfellows, a startup founded by Shantanu Naidu which offers companionship as a service to senior citizens. Goodfellows hires graduates with emotional intelligence to work with senior citizens and has been working with 20 elders for the last six months in its beta phase. Notably, Naidu is the General Manager in Tata's office.

173.title: I urge PM Modi to interfere: Ex-player Barua on FIFA suspending AIFF
173.article_body: Former Indian footballer Anadi Barua has "urged" PM Narendra Modi and Sports Minister Anurag Thakur to "interfere", after FIFA suspended the All India Football Federation (AIFF). "AIFF needs many changes...If this is not done soon...it will be more harmful," added Barua. Bengaluru FC owner Parth Jindal had earlier stated that the "worst Olympic federation" is "better" than the AIFF.
