174.title: Over 7.9 million enrolled under Baal Aadhaar from April to July: Govt
174.article_body: Over 7.9 million children, aged up to five, were enrolled under the Baal Aadhaar initiative from April to July, Electronics and Information Technology Ministry said. As many as 26.4 million children in the zero-five age group had been enrolled by the end of March, it added. "Baal Aadhaar works as a digital photo identity for children," the Ministry further said.

175.title: BMC to demolish over 100-yr-old dilapidated building in south Mumbai
175.article_body: Bombay HC has permitted Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation to demolish an over 100-year-old dilapidated building in south Mumbai and has directed its occupants to vacate the premises. The HN Petit Widows Home, which has five floors, was used to provide hostel facilities to widows. Due to the building's poor condition, the widows residing there were moved to another hostel in 2019.

176.title: Bengal dengue cases up 7 times till August 1st week as compared to last year
176.article_body: Dengue cases shot up nearly seven times in West Bengal till August first week as compared to last year. According to state Health Department, around 450 dengue cases were detected till first week of August in 2021. However, this year, the number has shot up to 3,104 during same period. The Health Department has submitted a report to chief secretary.

177.title: China announces new military drills as US delegation visits Taiwan
177.article_body: China announced more military drills on Tuesday after a five-member US delegation met Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen. Beijing has not revealed where and when the drills would be conducted. On Monday, Tsai said that her administration was working with allies to ensure stability in the Taiwan Strait, however, China accused US of trying to change the ''One China'' policy.

178.title: Gunmen kill 2 policemen escorting polio workers in Pakistan
178.article_body: Motorcycle-borne gunmen on Tuesday opened fire on police escorting a team of polio workers in northwestern Pakistan, killing two policemen, authorities said. The assailants fled the scene and no one group has claimed responsibility for the attack in Gomal town so far. The attack took place on the second day of Pakistan's latest anti-polio campaign in the province.

179.title: Delhi HC reserves order on PIL for Satyendar Jain’s disqualification
179.article_body: The Delhi HC reserved the order on a PIL seeking direction to disqualify Satyendar Jain from the Assembly and the Cabinet due to his 'memory loss' issue. The plea said that the government is violating Constitution's clause that specifies that a person shall be disqualified if he/she is of unsound mind and declared the same by a court.

180.title: Hyderabad man hangs himself on video call with wife
180.article_body: A 33-year-old Hyderabad-based man, Sai Karthik Goud died by suicide after an argument with his wife. The incident happened after Goud asked his wife to accompany him to his parents' house to celebrate Bonalu but she refused. Irritated over their argument, Goud put a noose around his neck and made a video call to his wife and hanged himself.

181.title: Menswear has changed drastically: Kunal Rawal on 15 yrs in fashion
181.article_body: Designer Kunal Rawal, who recently completed 15 years in the fashion industry, said menswear has "changed so drastically" and for the better. He said menswear is "far more democratic" now. "In the last few years, India has been more progressive and you have the strongest correlations. So, that is a big part of inspiration," he added.

182.title: I will try to 'outdo' Rishabh Pant in the boundary count: Ryan Burl
182.article_body: Zimbabwe's Ryan Burl, who recently smashed 34 runs in an over, in the third T20I against Bangladesh, said he will try and "outdo" Rishabh Pant in the boundary count during the ODI series against India. "I...see myself in Pant," added Burl. Burl earlier stated he was trying to "emulate" Yuvraj Singh in the over where he smashed 34 runs.

183.title: Maybe Ponting suffered jet lag: Salman Butt on 'Surya is like ABD' comment
183.article_body: Reacting to Ricky Ponting's comment that India batter Suryakumar Yadav is like former South Africa batter AB de Villiers, ex-Pakistan captain Salman Butt said that the comparison was a "bit too much". Butt added, "Suryakumar is yet to play in big tournaments...[and] the fact is nobody has ever played cricket like De Villiers....maybe Ponting suffered a jet lag."

184.title: Scientists develop smart contact lenses that can diagnose cancer
184.article_body: Scientists from the Terasaki Institute for Biomedical Innovation have developed smart contact lenses that can potentially screen and diagnose cancer. This lens can capture and detect exosomes, nanometer-sized vesicles found in tears, which have potential for being diagnostic cancer biomarkers. This may serve as an inexpensive screening programme for multiple types of cancer, researchers said.

185.title: 2 e-scooters catch fire, explode in Hyderabad
185.article_body: Two electric scooters caught fire as their batteries exploded while charging in Hyderabad on Monday. The owner of the vehicles T Haribabu said that he had recently purchased both electric scooters and he had put them on charge in front of his house. An hour later, he heard a loud explosion and saw both the two-wheelers engulfed in flames.

186.title: India's WPI inflation eases to 13.93% in July: Ministry data
186.article_body: India’s wholesale inflation declined to 13.93% in July, the Ministry of Commerce and Industry data showed. The Wholesale Price Index (WPI) based inflation has been in the double-digit for 16 months now. The rise in prices of mineral oils, food articles, crude petroleum and natural gas and electricity, among other things, contributed to inflation in July 2022, the ministry said.

187.title: 'Laal Singh…' is a piece of art, Aamir is pure genius: Neha Dhupia
187.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia has called Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha" a "piece of art". Calling Aamir a "pure genius", Neha requested fans to not fall for the boycott trend and make time to watch the film. She said the film is like magic that "transports you into a world where only goodness exists, truly and purely because its only heart".

188.title: 5 more ships depart from Ukraine under grain export deal: Turkey
188.article_body: Five more ships with corn and wheat have departed from Ukraine's Black Sea ports under the grain export deal signed last month, Turkey's Defence Ministry said on Tuesday. Another four ships headed for Ukraine were to undergo inspection on Tuesday by the joint co-ordination centre set up under the deal in Istanbul, the ministry added.

189.title: Pune Metro to extend till Dapodi, Deccan Gymkhana after I-Day trial run
189.article_body: After successful trial runs on August 15, Pune Metro is all set to expand from Garware College to Deccan Gymkhana and from Phugewadi to Dapodi, officials said. "The successful trial run on these routes have paved the way for extending the service till Shivajinagar on Reach 1 and Civil Court on Reach 2," public relations officer of Pune Metro said.

190.title: What is China's 'Yuan Wang 5' ship, being closely watched by India as it reaches SL?
190.article_body: India had earlier said it's 'monitoring the movements' of the Chinese surveillance ship 'Yuan Wang 5' which has now arrived in Sri Lanka. China uses the Yuan Wang class ships to track satellite and ballistic missile launches. It's in Lanka to do satellite control and research tracking of Chinese satellites. Reports suggested south Indian ports could be surveilled by it.

191.title: Kerala man launches 30,000-km solo bicycle ride to London on I-Day
191.article_body: On the occasion of Independence Day on Monday, a 34-year-old man from Kerala embarked on a solo cycle expedition from Thiruvananthapuram to spread the message of peace among countries. As per the itinerary, Faiz Ashraf Ali will cover 30,000 km and 35 countries on a bicycle and reach his destination, London, in 450 days. He'll travel from Mumbai-Oman by air.

192.title: Hotter summers fuelled by climate change may increase skin cancers: Experts
192.article_body: Higher summer temperatures caused due to climate change may lead to more cases of melanoma, one of the most serious types of skin cancer, say experts. "Melanoma is caused essentially by sunburn, and this weather is so extreme that I am concerned that sunburns will increase and...so will the incidence of melanoma," Julia Newton-Bishop, a clinician scientist, said.

193.title: Housing prices rise by 4% in April-June quarter in Bengaluru: Report
193.article_body: Housing prices in Bengaluru increased by 4% to ₹7,848 per square foot in April to June quarter as compared to last year, a report by CREDAI, Colliers and Liases Foras said. Bengaluru also saw the highest dip in unsold inventory of 21% on year-on-year basis, the report said, adding that prices rose by 4% in the city's outer south region.

194.title: Tragic loss of precious lives: Prez condoles death of ITBP personnel in J&K
194.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Tuesday condoled the death of seven ITBP personnel who died after their bus fell into a river bed in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam. "The tragic loss of precious lives of ITBP personnel in the unfortunate accident at Anantnag, Jammu and Kashmir fills me with sadness. My heartfelt condolences for the bereaved families," the Rashtrapati Bhavan tweeted.

195.title: It's ludicrous to suggest Rushdie's responsible for attack on him: UK
195.article_body: The UK said it's "ludicrous" to suggest that author Salman Rushdie was responsible for the attack on him. This comes after Iran suggested that Rushdie had "exposed himself to...anger and rage of the people" by insulting Islamic sanctities and "crossing the red lines of over 1.5 billion Muslims". Rushdie was stabbed by a 24-year-old man in New York on Friday.

196.title: He made faces, talked in derogatory tone: Taapsee on argument with photographer
196.article_body: While talking about her recent video where she can be seen in an argument with a photographer at an event, actress Taapsee Pannu said that the photographer "kept making faces" at her and spoke to her in a derogatory tone. "I did not want to retaliate. I folded my hands and accepted whatever he had to say," she added.

197.title: Supreme Court to hear AIFF case tomorrow after FIFA's suspension
197.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday will hear the case related to the All India Football Federation (AIFF) after the Central government sought an urgent hearing in the matter following FIFA's suspension of the Indian football body. Solicitor General of India Tushar Mehta requested the urgent hearing, stating that "some development" has taken place in relation to AIFF.

198.title: Pakistan wants bloodbath in Kashmir: J&K BJP chief on killing of Kashmiri Pandit
198.article_body: J&K BJP chief Ravinder Raina on Tuesday condemned the incident where a Kashmiri Pandit was killed in Shopian after terrorists fired upon civilians. "Pakistan wants to turn Kashmir into graveyard...[It] wants a bloodbath in Kashmir...we won't allow it to fulfil its nefarious designs," Raina said. "Those involved in targeting Kashmiri Pandits...will be taken to task," he stated.

199.title: Online game chat helps Delhi Police reunite minor girl with family
199.article_body: A 16-year-old girl was reunited with her family by the Delhi Police after examining a conversation that took place in the online game, 'Free Fire'. The game's chat helped the police contact her friend, who informed the police that she had contacted him through an auto-rickshaw driver's phone, following which she was found at Gurudwara Bangla Sahib.

200.title: Woman poisons 3 daughters after spat with husband in UP
200.article_body: A woman poisoned her three daughters following a spat with her husband over a domestic issue in UP's Ghazipur. Two daughters died on the spot, while the third succumbed during treatment in the hospital, reports said. The police have registered a case for murder against the woman, who is in police custody, according to reports.

201.title: IIT Bombay reacts after being criticised for photoshopping Tricolour on campus in FB pic
201.article_body: IIT Bombay has reacted after being criticised for photoshopping the Tricolour on campus in a Facebook picture. "The picture of IIT Bombay Main Building with a flag was a depiction to commemorate Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav and not an actual photo. Our goal was to create the spirit of the Mahotsav. We regret the confusion this may've caused," it said.

202.title: Man shot, then stabbed to death during gambling session in Gujarat
202.article_body: A man died after he was shot in the stomach and later stabbed in the chest, neck and shoulder while he was gambling in Gujarat's Gandhinagar on Sunday afternoon. Police found playing cards at the murder scene and suspect the crime to be a fallout of some dispute. The deceased reportedly had an enmity with a local politician too.

203.title: Delhi man threatens mother-in-law at gunpoint, fires into wall; held
203.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested on Monday after he allegedly fired into the wall of his mother-in-law's house while threatening her at gunpoint when he went there to take his estranged wife home, the police said. An officer said that the accused had apparently fired in his mother-in-law's general direction. No one was injured in the incident, the police added.

204.title: Iran submits written response in 2015 nuclear deal talks: Reports
204.article_body: Iran has submitted a written response in the ongoing talks to restore 2015 nuclear deal. Tehran would not take the proposal mediated by the European Union, Iran's state-run news agency IRNA reported. "The differences are on three issues...the US...expressed...verbal flexibility in two cases, but it should be included in the text," the IRNA report said.

205.title: Karnataka minister says 'govt not functioning, somehow managing'; CM Bommai responds
205.article_body: Karnataka Law and Parliamentary Affairs Minister JC Madhuswamy has purportedly claimed that the state government is not functioning and added that the officials are somehow managing. Commenting on Madhuswamy's remarks, CM Basavaraj Bommai said the minister's statements were made in a "different context". Madhuswamy's remarks were revealed in an audio leak.

206.title: SS Rajamouli: Actor Manav Gohil on the person he last fantasised about
206.article_body: Actor Manav Gohil, who was seen in 'Baaghi 3' and 'Super 30', said in an interview that the last person he "fantasised" about was 'RRR' director SS Rajamouli. Manav added Brad Pitt is the same-sex actor he's crushing on, terming actress Raveena Tandon as his celebrity crush. Talking about the place where he first kissed someone, Manav named Sweden.

207.title: Aditya shouldn't sit in cave, dictate filmmakers: Anurag on Shamshera failing
207.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap opened up about 'Shamshera' failing at the box office and said that Aditya Chopra needs to empower filmmakers and not dictate them or control their casting. "You've one person sitting in a cave, who doesn't know the world outside, dictating how everybody should be making their films...telling them what to do," he said speaking about Aditya.

208.title: 2-time champion Murray beats Wawrinka to enter second round at Cincinnati Open
208.article_body: Ex-world number one Andy Murray defeated three-time Grand Slam champion Stanislas Wawrinka 7-6(7-3), 5-7, 7-5 in the first round at Cincinnati Open on Monday. The two-time champion will now face ninth-seeded Cameron Norrie, who beat Dane Holger Rune 7-6(7-5), 4-6, 6-4, in the second round. Unseeded Frances Tiafoe defeated 12th-seeded Matteo Berrettini 7-6(7-3), 4-6, 7-6(7-5) to reach second round.

209.title: You don't know what it's like to be lonely: Tata on investing in startup for senior citizens
209.article_body: Ratan Tata on Tuesday announced an undisclosed investment in GoodFellows, a startup founded by Shantanu Naidu that offers companionship to senior citizens as a service. "You don't know what it's like to be lonely until you spend time alone wishing for companionship," Tata said at the launch. He added no one cares about getting old until they actually get old.

210.title: Our domestic level is not that great in women's cricket: Harmanpreet Kaur
210.article_body: India Women captain Harmanpreet Kaur has said that the domestic level in women's cricket is not that great in India and the Women's IPL might help prepare girls for the international level. "[In] women's IPL...our domestic players will also get a chance to play with overseas players...they'll not feel that pressure...when they play international games," explained Kaur.

211.title: Part of body of boy who went missing after Kullu flash floods recovered
211.article_body: A part of the body of a boy who had gone missing after flash floods in Kullu has been recovered, news agency ANI reported. Another body was also found. Sub Divisional Magistrate of Manali said that around 100 people, including NDRF, police, fire brigade, team of administration and local volunteers deployed for rescue operations, were present on spot.

212.title: 5 men, minor boy repeatedly rape 17-year-old girl in Maha, arrested
212.article_body: Five men were arrested and a minor boy was detained for allegedly raping a 17-year-old girl repeatedly in Maharashtra's Aurangabad, police said on Tuesday. The victim's parents approached the police on Saturday, following which the five accused were arrested, a senior police official said. The accused were produced before a court, which sent them to police custody till August 17.

213.title: Class 12 girl returning from I-Day celebrations run over by bus in Chennai
213.article_body: A Class 12 girl, who was returning from Independence Day celebrations at school, was killed after being hit by a Metropolitan Transport Corporation (MTC) bus in Chennai on Monday. A CCTV footage shows the deceased student and her friend riding their bicycles on Rajendra Prasad Road when the bus passes by. The bus driver had surrendered on Monday, police said.

214.title: Aus city votes to remove 132-yr-old statue of grave-robbing politician
214.article_body: Australian city of Hobart in Tasmania voted to remove a 132-year-old statue commemorating a politician who stole the skull of an Aboriginal man from a local morgue and replaced it with that of another corpse. The removal of William Crowther's statue is a "part of the process of truth-telling" about the history of Tasmania, Hobart's Lord Mayor Anna Reynolds said.

215.title: Oscars apologises to actress Sacheen 50 years after she was booed off the stage
215.article_body: The Academy Awards has apologised to Native American actress Sacheen Littlefeather nearly 50 years after she was booed off the stage. At the 1973 Academy Awards, Littlefeather was heckled as she explained why Marlon Brando had rejected best actor award for 'The Godfather' on his behalf. Littlefeather later said actor John Wayne had to be restrained from physically assaulting her.

216.title: Dubai Crown Prince goes unnoticed while travelling in London metro, shares pics
216.article_body: Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Al Maktoum, the Crown Prince of Dubai, travelled in the London metro (Tube) and went unrecognised. Sheikh Hamdan shared pictures of himself standing on a crowded train with his fellow commuters seemingly unaware of his identity. The pictures got over 10,000 comments, one of which said, "These poor people have no idea with whom they're travelling."

217.title: 6 Shrikant Tyagi's associates jailed for creating ruckus, granted bail
217.article_body: Six associates of politician Shrikant Tyagi, jailed for entering and creating ruckus at Grand Omaxe society in Noida, Sector 93 have been granted bail today. These associates had barged into the society and demanded the address of the woman who confronted Tyagi. Self-proclaimed politician Tyagi was arrested by Noida Police for molesting and abusing a woman.

218.title: Prem Watsa-backed Digit Insurance files draft papers for IPO
218.article_body: Bengaluru-based startup Go Digit General Insurance has filed draft papers with the SEBI for an initial public offering (IPO). The startup, backed by billionaire Prem Watsa's Fairfax Financial Holdings, will sell 10.9 crore shares in its offer-for-sale portion and issue new stock worth ₹1,250 crore through IPO. The company may also sell shares worth ₹250 crore in a pre-IPO placement.

219.title: Ancient watermelons tasted bitter and could kill you: Study
219.article_body: A study has found that watermelons cultivated around 6,000 years ago tasted bitter and could have also killed a person on consumption. Our ancestors removed the red flesh and only consumed the seeds of the fruit. Scientists believe the pungent taste of watermelon must have changed after domestication, as fruits tend to lose some of their traits during the process.

220.title: 4 people returning from Jagannath Temple rescued from floods in Odisha
220.article_body: Four pilgrims returning from Jagannath Temple were rescued after their car was stuck in floodwaters in Odisha's Cuttack district on Monday night. Notably, incessant rainfall for past few days led to flooding in Mahanadi river with water entering low-lying areas in Jajpur and Dasarathpur blocks. Earlier, eight gates of Hirakud dam were closed to prevent any large-scale flooding downstream.

221.title: Crypto lender Celsius' actual debt stands at $2.85 billion: Report
221.article_body: Filings from a new bankruptcy report have shown that crypto lender Celsius Network's actual debt stands at $2.85 billion, against their bankruptcy claims of a $1.2 billion deficit, Cointelegraph reported. The report states that Celsius has around $4.3 billion in assets against $5.5 billion in liabilities. Celsius had filed for bankruptcy after collapse in value of Terra USD.

222.title: DFM Foods shares hit 20% upper circuit on delisting proposal
222.article_body: The shares of DFM Foods Limited hit the 20% upper circuit on Tuesday for the second consecutive session to ₹304 apiece at opening trade on the BSE. On Monday, private equity firm Advent International, a majority stakeholder in DFM Foods via its subsidiary AI Global Investments, announced the proposal to delist the snack maker from the stock exchanges.

223.title: Amitabh Bachchan asks question about boAt on KBC 14, Co-founder Aman Gupta reacts
223.article_body: In a recent episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 14', Amitabh Bachchan asked a question about electronics brand boAt. Co-founder Aman Gupta, sharing a screenshot of the question, wrote on Instagram, "Aaj khush toh boAt hoge tum, Hainnn. Proud to see entrepreneurs and startups as General Knowledge questions." "Superb," Aman's Shark Tank India fellow judge Ashneer Grover commented on the post.

224.title: Amul, Mother Dairy to raise milk prices by ₹2 per litre from tomorrow
224.article_body: Amul has announced that it's increasing its milk prices by ₹2 per litre from August 17. The prices of Amul milk will be hiked in areas like Gujarat's Ahmedabad and Saurashtra, Delhi NCR, West Bengal, Mumbai and other markets where Amul markets fresh milk. Mother Dairy also announced that it is increasing milk prices by ₹2 per litre from tomorrow.

225.title: Ready to work with Centre to improve healthcare, don't call it freebie: Kejriwal
225.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Monday appealed to the Centre to not term free education and health care facilities as "freebies". "We are ready to work with the Centre to improve healthcare services and education…I offer central government to use our services," CM Kejriwal added. "All state governments can work together," CM Kejriwal said.

226.title: Grand Alliance is stronger with Nitish Kumar: Manoj Jha
226.article_body: Backing the RJD-JD(U) alliance in Bihar, MP Manoj Jha claimed that the “map of 2024 elections is clear” up to a great extent. “This entire Mahagathbandhan is stronger with Nitish Kumar coming into the alliance. So, the map of 2024 is clear up to a great extent,” said Jha. JD(U), earlier this month, formed a new government with RJD.

227.title: Manipur to add police outposts along Myanmar border to check infiltration
227.article_body: The Manipur government has approved a proposal to set up 34 new police outposts along the India-Myanmar border to check illegal immigration from Myanmar, said CM N Biren Singh. The outposts will come up between Jessami and Behiang villages. Singh was addressing an event at 1st Manipur Rifles Parade Ground in Imphal on the occasion of 76th Independence Day.

228.title: Kashmiri Pandit killed, his brother injured as terrorists fire on civilians in J&K
228.article_body: A Kashmiri Pandit was killed and his brother injured after terrorists fired upon civilians in an apple orchard in Shopian district of Jammu and Kashmir on Tuesday, police said. The deceased was identified as Sunil Kumar Bhat and his brother as Pintu Kumar. The injured person was shifted to a hospital and the area has been cordoned off, police added.

229.title: Want to see how Rue looks in sobriety journey: Zendaya on 'Euphoria'
229.article_body: Speaking about season 3 of her show 'Euphoria', actress Zendaya said, "I want to see what Rue (her character in the show) looks like in her sobriety journey, how chaotic that might look." She further added that it will be "exciting" to explore the characters out of high school. The release date of season 3 is not yet known.

230.title: Ukraine demands new sanctions on Russia after fresh shelling near nuclear plant
230.article_body: Ukraine has called for new sanctions on Russia and highlighted risks of a catastrophe at Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant after fresh shelling. "If through Russia's actions a catastrophe occurs, the consequences could hit those who for the moment are silent," Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said. Ukrainian and Russian officials accused each other of carrying out attacks near Zaporizhzhia.

231.title: Apollo Tyres' shares jump after Q1 net profit surges by 49%
231.article_body: The shares of Apollo Tyres are trading high after the company reported a 49% surge in its consolidated net profit at ₹190.68 crore for the quarter ended June. Its revenue from operations stood at ₹5,942 crore, a 29.6% jump from ₹4,584.47 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. At 1:50 pm, its shares were up 5.80% on the NSE.

232.title: Ex-Aus PM Morrison defends taking secret ministerial roles during COVID
232.article_body: Former Australian PM Scott Morrison defended his secret portfolio appointments between March 2020 and May 2021, saying they were "safeguards" and "the right decision" during the COVID-19 pandemic. Morrison added he'd have made the appointments public had he needed to use the powers involved. "Sometimes we forget what was happening two years ago...It was an...unprecedented time," he further said.

233.title: Amul to raise milk prices by ₹2 per litre in some areas from tomorrow
233.article_body: Amul on Tuesday announced that it's increasing the price for its milk across several regions in India by ₹2 per litre. The revised prices of milk will be effective from August 17, the company said. The prices will be hiked in areas like Gujarat's Ahmedabad and Saurashtra, Delhi NCR, West Bengal, Mumbai and other markets where Amul markets fresh milk.

234.title: COVID-style control room set up to tackle lumpy skin disease in Udaipur
234.article_body: Udaipur district administration has set up a COVID-19-like control room to tackle the lumpy skin disease in cattle. "The control room has been established at the district level, and at the block level we have created a rapid response team so that they can deal with suspected cases at the earliest," Joint Director, animal husbandry, said.

235.title: Portfolios allocated in Bihar; CM Nitish keeps Home, Deputy CM Tejashwi gets Health
235.article_body: As many as 31 leaders were inducted into Bihar's new Cabinet under CM Nitish Kumar on Tuesday. CM Nitish has kept the Home Ministry, while Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav has been appointed the Health Minister. RJD's Tej Pratap Yadav has been appointed the Minister of Environment, Forest and Climate Change. Vijay Kumar Choudhary has been made the Finance Minister.

236.title: Rajinikanth's daughter pens a note after actor completes 47 yrs in industry
236.article_body: Actor Rajinikanth's daughter penned a note on Twitter after the actor completed 47 years in the industry. While wishing Twitter users on Independence Day, Aishwaryaa wrote, "47 years of Rajinism...sheer hard work, grit and dedication!" She further said that she is proud to be his daughter. Rajinikanth made his acting debut in the 1975 film 'Apoorva Raagangal'.

237.title: As women, we face the issue every day: Huma Qureshi on body shaming
237.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi opened up about addressing the issue of body shaming in her film 'Double XL'. "As women, we face [the issue] every...day...Body shaming erodes somebody's confidence," she added. Huma said they, as actors, aim to create awareness regarding body shaming through the film. "We wanted to make an entertaining film...bring about a change in people's mindset," she concluded.

238.title: JP Nadda likely to meet with BJP Bihar core panel in Delhi: Reports
238.article_body: After BJP-JD(U) alliance broke up, BJP President JP Nadda is likely to hold a meeting with the party's Bihar core committee today in Delhi, reports said. He is likely to discuss the political upheaval and chalk out a strategy. Mahagathbandhan has the support of 164 members in the Assembly and also has the backing of four Hindustani Awam Morcha MLAs.

239.title: People don't want such a CM: BJP on KCR skipping Guv's 'At Home' function
239.article_body: Union Minister G Kishan Reddy criticised K Chandrashekar Rao for not attending Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan's 'At Home' function at Raj Bhavan on the occasion of Independence Day. "TRS is running a government of corruption-dictatorship for eight years. CM doesn't meet people and stays in a farmhouse 15 days every month. People don't want such a CM," Reddy said.

240.title: Congress criticises CM Mamata for omitting Nehru's picture
240.article_body: West Bengal Congress has criticised West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee for leaving former PM Jawaharlal Nehru out of her Twitter display picture, featuring prominent freedom fighters. Congress retweeted a post of Nehru's speech ‘Tryst with Destiny’ shared by a user. “History lesson for Mamata from a kid. Because they purposefully omitted Nehru from their DP,” said Congress.

241.title: Odisha govt closes 8 gates of Hirakud dam amid flood threat
241.article_body: The Odisha government has closed eight gates of Hirakud reservoir fearing a possible flood-like situation may emerge in the state. The water of the Mahanadi river is rising due to torrential rains in the catchment areas, said officials. "Water is being discharged through 26 gates instead of the 34 gates," said Special Relief Commissioner PK Jena.

242.title: Suspect brought for court hearing shot dead in UP's Hapur
242.article_body: A suspect who was brought for a hearing to the Uttar Pradesh's Hapur District Court was shot dead by unidentified assailants outside the premises on Tuesday. The undertrial had been brought from Haryana for the hearing. The suspect was arrested in Faridabad and when he was brought to court, the assailants surrounded him and fired four-five bullets.

243.title: As coal prices rise, Indian firms import petcoke from Venezuela
243.article_body: Amid surging global coal prices, Indian companies are importing large volumes of petroleum coke (petcoke) from Venezuela, according to trade sources and shipping data. Indian cement companies imported as many as four cargoes carrying 1,60,000 tonnes of petroleum coke between April and June, according to trade sources. Another cargo is expected to reach the Mangalore port soon, the data showed.

244.title: Telangana CM KCR skips Governor’s ‘At Home’ function
244.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao skipped Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan's traditional 'At Home' event on the occasion of Independence Day at Raj Bhavan. He had attended ‘At Home’ functions till 2020 when the relations between the CM’s office and the Raj Bhavan were cordial, reports said. Meanwhile, the CM alleged that the Centre is busy in centralising powers.

245.title: US, China may sleepwalk into conflict over Taiwan: Singapore's Dy PM
245.article_body: Singapore's Deputy PM Lawrence Wong warned that the US and China may "sleepwalk into conflict" if they don't engage with each other and de-escalate rising tensions over Taiwan. The US-China relationship is on a "very worrying" trajectory, Wong said, adding, "We're starting to see a series of decisions being taken by both countries that'll lead us into more...dangerous territory."

246.title: US' KKR sells entire 27% stake in Max Healthcare, raises ₹9,290 cr
246.article_body: US private equity firm KKR sold all of its 27% stake in Max Healthcare and raised ₹9,290 crore on Tuesday. KKR offloaded 26 crore shares at ₹355 apiece. The stake sale, through a block deal, was executed by Kalyan Investments which had invested in Max Healthcare. It sold its stake at a discount of 3.3% to the current market price.

247.title: Washington Sundar ruled out of India's tour of Zimbabwe, replaced by Shahbaz Ahmed
247.article_body: All-rounder Washington Sundar has been ruled out of India's tour of Zimbabwe after injuring his shoulder while playing in a county match in England. He has been replaced by 27-year-old all-rounder Shahbaz Ahmed, who represents Bengal in domestic cricket and RCB in IPL. India will play three ODIs in Zimbabwe starting August 18.

248.title: Sri Lanka Cricket seeks ₹43.5 crore from Arjuna Ranatunga for 'loss of reputation'
248.article_body: The Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) administrators are seeking LKR 2 billion (more than ₹43.5 crore) from former World Cup-winning captain Arjuna Ranatunga for "loss of reputation". The SLC Executive Committee stated that it took the decision after "extensively deliberating" on a "false, derogatory and distorted statement" made by Ranatunga during a recent media interview.

249.title: Forever 21 owner Authentic Brands to buy Ted Baker for $254 million
249.article_body: Authentic Brands (ABG) has agreed to buy Ted Baker in a cash deal worth roughly £211 million ($254 million), the companies announced on Tuesday. The UK-based fashion chain was forced to put itself up for sale in April after it suffered COVID-19 pandemic-related losses. New York-based ABG owns brands like Forever 21, Juicy Couture and Reebok.

250.title: I am seeing it as the Asia Cup, not India vs Pakistan: Sourav Ganguly
250.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said he is looking at the Asia Cup as a tournament rather than considering it as India taking on Pakistan. "When I used to...[play], India vs Pakistan was just another match for me. I always looked to win the tournament," added Ganguly. "India...have done very well in the recent times," he stated.

251.title: Debina Bonnerjee, Gurmeet Choudhary expecting their 2nd baby; share ultrasound pics
251.article_body: Television actors Debina Bonnerjee and Gurmeet Choudhary are expecting their second baby. Debina, who shared a picture of herself hugging Gurmeet and gave a glimpse of ultrasound images, wrote, "Few decisions are divinely timed and nothing can change that...this is one such blessing." The couple welcomed their first child, daughter Lianna, in April this year.

252.title: UP man gets alleged beheading threat after he distributes Tricolour
252.article_body: An FIR has been registered after a man alleged that posters threatening him with beheading were pasted around his house after he distributed the Tricolour in his neighbourhood in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor. A senior police official said that security has been deployed at the man's residence. "Action will be taken on the basis of facts," the senior police official added.

253.title: Film journalist Kaushik LM passes away at 35
253.article_body: Film journalist Kaushik LM has passed away at the age of 35. Kaushik went to sleep at 2 pm on Monday and reportedly suffered a cardiac arrest. "Thinking of you and saying a prayer. You will be missed," actor Vijay Deverakonda tweeted. "This is truly heartbreaking. I so so wish this isn't true," actor Dulquer Salmaan wrote.

254.title: 'Dostvaad' should also end: Sisodia on PM's 'Parivarvaad' remark
254.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said not just 'Parivarvaad' (dynasty politics), but 'Dostvaad' (favouring friends) should also be ended to cleanse the country of corruption. "Dostvaad has destroyed the country's economy," Sisodia said at a press conference on Monday. His comments came after PM Modi called upon people to extend their support in the "fight against nepotism and dynasty systems".

255.title: PM Modi extends birthday wishes to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal
255.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday greeted Delhi CM and AAP national convenor on his 54th birthday. "Birthday greetings to Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal Ji. I pray for his long life and good health," PM Modi tweeted. Kejriwal replied saying, "Thank you sir." Meanwhile, other politicians including Bhagwanth Khuba, Hardeep Singh Puri and Supriya Sule also wished CM Kejriwal.

256.title: Delhi boys return from holiday, find mom, grandmother dead with stab wounds
256.article_body: A 70-year-old woman and her daughter-in-law were found dead when the former's grandsons, who were on a holiday in Uttarakhand, returned and found their bodies with stab wounds. Police said that no signs of forced entry into the house were found and that the boys found the main door partially open. Investigators suspect involvement of someone known to the women.

257.title: Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel announces 3% DA hike for govt employees
257.article_body: Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel, on the occasion of India's 76th Independence Day on Monday, announced a 3% hike in the dearness allowance (DA) for state government employees under the 7th Pay Commission, with retrospective effect from January 1, 2022. The hike will benefit around 9.38 lakh employees of the Gujarat government, panchayat service and pensioners, Patel added.

258.title: iSelect Guaranteed Future Plan for financial planning: Canara HSBC
258.article_body: iSelect Guaranteed Future Plan presented by Canara HSBC is a life insurance savings cum protection plan that provides you 5 options to cater to your needs with Pay or Premium Protection Cover. The plan offers tax saving benefits along with an alternate source of savings to help you achieve your financial goals, it stated.

259.title: Militant group claims it killed 4 Russian mercenaries in Mali
259.article_body: An Al-Qaeda-affiliated terrorist group on Monday claimed that it had killed four mercenaries from Russia's private military firm Wagner Group in an ambush in central Mali. The militants of Jama'at Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimeen (JNIM) group reportedly clashed with the Russian mercenaries on Saturday in the Mopti region. Mali has been fighting Islamist insurgency for decades.

260.title: Heavy rain in Mumbai; MeT predicts occasional intense showers in next 24 hrs
260.article_body: Mumbai witnessed heavy rainfall on Tuesday as rain intensity increased in the city after a gap of a few days. As per Meteorological department's forecast, cloudy sky with moderate rain in Mumbai and suburbs with occasional intense spells is expected for the next 24 hours. There will be a high tide of 4.39 metres in Arabian Sea, an official said.

261.title: Indian team looks different when Hardik is in full flow: Zimbabwe batting coach
261.article_body: Zimbabwe batting coach Lance Klusener has said India looks different when all-rounder Hardik Pandya is in "full flow". He added, "Hardik adds glue to any white-ball side...It's so good to have him back and he's getting into the form we are accustomed to." Hardik is not part of India's squad for the three-match ODI series against Zimbabwe.

262.title: Team India was 'not that' aggressive under Virat Kohli: Aakash Chopra
262.article_body: Former India opener Aakash Chopra said Virat Kohli was very aggressive on the field while leading Team India but his team was "not that" aggressive. "He talked about intent many times but we saw [Cheteshwar] Pujara getting run out twice in one match," added Aakash. "Rohit Sharma...doesn't look animated but the team that plays under him attacks," he stated.

263.title: Ask senior Muslim community members to take action: BJP MLA on Shivamogga incident
263.article_body: BJP MLA KS Eshwarappa reacted to the stabbing incident following communal clashes in Shivamogga, saying, "I request senior members of Muslim community to take action against youth of their community [who are] involved in such anti-national activities." Four people, identified as Nadeem, Tanveer, Charbi and Abdul Rehman, were arrested in connection with the stabbing incident, PTI reported.

264.title: Kunal Ghosh gives secret news of TMC to BJP: BJP MP Saumitra Khan
264.article_body: BJP MP Saumitra Khan has claimed that TMC spokesperson Kunal Ghosh gives the "secret news" of TMC to BJP. "When Ghosh was in jail even then he used to pass on inside news of TMC to people and even now after meeting [Dharmendra] Pradhan, Ghosh continues to give the secret news of TMC to BJP," Khan added.

265.title: Bus carrying 39 security personnel falls into riverbed after brake fail in J&K, 6 martyred
265.article_body: Six Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) personnel have lost their lives, while several others received injuries after a bus carrying 37 ITBP personnel and two personnel from Jammu and Kashmir Police fell into a riverbed in Pahalgam after its brakes reportedly failed on Tuesday. Injured personnel are being airlifted to Army hospital, Srinagar for treatment, police said.

266.title: Bipasha Basu expecting 1st child with Karan Singh Grover, shares pics
266.article_body: Actress Bipasha Basu on Tuesday announced that she is expecting her first child with actor-husband Karan Singh Grover. Sharing pictures, she wrote, "A new time, a new phase, a new light adds another unique shade to our prism of life." "A creation manifested by our love, our baby will join us soon and add to our glee," she added.

267.title: 20 people burnt alive in bus-oil tanker collision in Pakistan
267.article_body: At least 20 people were burnt alive in a collision between a passenger bus and an oil tanker in Pakistan's Punjab province, rescue officials said. The accident occurred on a highway in Multan, around 350 km from Lahore, allegedly because of over-speeding, the police said. "The bodies will be handed over to the families after a DNA test," officials said.

268.title: Berkshire Hathaway buys more Apple, Chevron shares, sells Verizon stock
268.article_body: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway purchased 3.9 million shares of Apple in the second quarter, increasing its stake in the firm to 5.6%. It also raised its stake in Chevron to about 8.2% by buying around 2.3 million more shares of it. Among the holdings that were disposed of by Berkshire in Q2 were Verizon and Royalty Pharma.

269.title: Want to play a man who wears uniform as my dad was in Army: Abhishek
269.article_body: Actor Abhishek Banerjee has said that he wants to play a role of a man who wears a uniform. Speaking about the reason, he said, "I've seen my dad, he was in the Army...I've seen him waking up at 4 am and doing the duties," he added. Abhishek added he's closely seen the physical and mental endurance the officers need.

270.title: It's 1st time I'll share stage with Nick: Priyanka on Global Citizen festival
270.article_body: Speaking about the Global Citizen music festival, actress Priyanka Chopra has said that it will be the first time she will share the stage with her husband Nick Jonas. "It'll be very exciting. I love the Jonas Brothers, but I'm...excited to see Mariah Carey and Rosalía," she further added. Metallica and Charlie Puth will also feature at the music festival.

271.title: Germany's Scholz voices support for Russian refugees coming to EU
271.article_body: During a summit in Oslo, German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said people are fleeing Russia because they disagree with the Russian regime. The statement comes amid an ongoing debate over EU visa ban on Russian citizens. Finnish PM Sanna Marin said she didn't think it was right for Russians to go ''sightseeing'' in the EU while the Russian military kills Ukrainians.

272.title: Suspended railway policeman held in Pune in 'rice puller' metal scam
272.article_body: Pune Police arrested a suspended railway police sub-inspector in connection with the 'rice puller' metal scam. The accused allegedly cheated around 200 people in Maharashtra on the pretext of investing in a 'rice puller' metal, also called 'copper iridium', used by aerospace organisations to make space equipment. This comes after two brothers from Pune were cheated of ₹49 lakh.

273.title: Petrol, diesel demand sees a slump in August due to monsoons
273.article_body: With the onset of the monsoon, the fuel demand saw a slump in sectors such as agriculture, preliminary industry data showed. While petrol consumption remained flat in the first half of August, diesel demand witnessed an 11.2% drop compared with the first half of July. The demand for petrol and diesel is traditionally lower in July-September than in April-June.

274.title: India might have nomination in 'final 5' if RRR is picked: Kashyap on Oscars
274.article_body: Talking about the Oscars, filmmaker Anurag Kashyap said, "India might...have a nomination in the final five if 'RRR' is the film...we pick." Kashyap added there are "99% chances" of 'RRR' being nominated for the Oscars if selected as India's official entry. "[The West] finds it better than any Marvel movie. They've...gone crazy even at the film's silliness," he stated.

275.title: MMRDA plans tunnel to connect Eastern Freeway to Girgaon Chowpatty: Report
275.article_body: The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) is reportedly exploring the possibility of constructing a tunnel to connect Eastern Freeway from P D'Mello Road to Girgaon Chowpatty to ensure smooth access to the coastal road. As per the report, MMRDA has invited bids to finalise a consultant to conduct a feasibility study and make a detailed project report.

276.title: Around 30 ministers join Bihar Cabinet, Tejashwi Yadav's brother Tej Pratap sworn-in
276.article_body: Nearly 30 leaders, including Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Tejashwi Yadav's brother and RJD leader Tej Pratap Yadav, were sworn in as part of Bihar's new Cabinet under Chief Minister Nitish Kumar. Ahead of the Cabinet expansion, JD(U) MLA Leshi Singh on Tuesday confirmed that she will be getting a post in the new cabinet.

277.title: Bite marks on man's face help police catch him for molesting 17-yr-old girl in Thane
277.article_body: Bite marks on a man's face helped the Thane police trace and arrest him for allegedly molesting a 17-year-old girl on a skywalk in Maharashtra's Thane. Police said that the accused allegedly caught hold of her from behind and molested her, following which she resisted his move and bit his face to free herself. She later approached the police.

278.title: Person hoists religious flag above national flag in Goa; arrested
278.article_body: A 43-year-old man was arrested on Monday for allegedly hoisting a religious flag above the national flag at his rented accommodation in Goa's Ponda. A police inspector told IANS that the other flag "is not Pakistan's national flag, but a resemblance". A case has been filed under Section 2 of the Prevention of Insults to National Honour Act, 1971.

279.title: US Justice Dept opposes revealing evidence supporting search of Trump’s home
279.article_body: The US Justice Department opposed efforts to make public the affidavit supporting the search warrant for ex-US President Donald Trump's Florida home, saying the document contains sensitive material. Making the affidavit public would also "cause significant and irreparable damage to this ongoing criminal investigation," it added. Many news organisations have applied to have the affidavit unsealed.

280.title: A film rich in merit can take boycott, 'Laal...' didn't have merit: Taran
280.article_body: Film critic Taran Adarsh said a film rich in merit can withstand boycott and any opposition in the form of exams, IPL matches and bad weather. "'Laal Singh Chaddha'...was devoid of merit," he added. "The stars are still sleeping," stated Taran. Producer Girish Johar earlier said the box office start of 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and 'Raksha Bandhan' had sent "shockwaves".

281.title: We're asking India to bring their A game: Zimbabwe batting coach Lance Klusener
281.article_body: Zimbabwe batting coach and ex-South Africa all-rounder Lance Klusener has said they want India to bring their "A game" in their upcoming three-match ODI series. "It's a series we're looking forward to...they may be too strong for us but if we play well and put them under pressure, then ODI cricket is a funny game...anything can happen," he added.

282.title: Adani Logistics acquires ICD in Gujarat's Tumb for ₹835 crore
282.article_body: Adani Logistics on Tuesday announced that it has acquired an inland container depot (ICD) in Gujarat's Tumb from Navkar Corporation for ₹835 crore. ICD Tumb has a capacity of 0.5 million TEU and is located between the Hazira port and the Nhava Sheva port. Adani Logistics is a wholly owned subsidiary of Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone Limited.

283.title: Sidharth Malhotra & Kiara Advani to reunite after 'Shershaah': Report
283.article_body: Sidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani will reportedly reunite for a film after 'Shershaah'. As per a report by India Today, the film is titled 'Adal Badal' and will be produced by Sunir Kheterpal. "The movie is set to be a rom-com with a lot of VFX and CGI work involved as well," a source close to the development said.

284.title: US, S Korea, Japan hold missile defence drills for the 1st time since 2017
284.article_body: US, South Korea and Japan carried out a ballistic missile defence exercise off Hawaii's coast, the Pentagon said in a statement. It was first such exercise since 2017 which saw participation of the three countries. The Pentagon's statement said that the drills demonstrated the three countries' commitment to respond to challenges posed by North Korea and protect shared security.

285.title: H&M back on Alibaba's Tmall, 16 months after Xinjiang controversy
285.article_body: Swedish fashion retailer H&M's official store on Alibaba's Tmall e-commerce platform reopened after the latter had taken it down 16 months earlier. H&M had cited concerns about human rights abuses in China's Xinjiang and had pledged not to source cotton from that region. According to UN experts and other rights groups, Uyghurs and other minorities have been detained in Xinjiang.

286.title: US' World Trade Centre digitally displays Tricolour to celebrate India's Independence Day
286.article_body: The World Trade Centre in New York digitally displayed the Tricolour to celebrate India's Independence Day. Earlier, US President Joe Biden extended wishes to India, saying, "The US joins the people of India to honour its democratic journey, guided by Mahatma Gandhi's enduring message of truth and non-violence." He also said that India and US are "indispensable partners".

287.title: Jhunjhunwala's 1st purchase of Titan stock was made by chance: Damani
287.article_body: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's first purchase of Titan Company stock was made by chance, investor Ramesh Damani has revealed. "There is this folklore that he bought Titan after studying it or after accessing some insider information, but...he bought it because his broker had a lot and he came to Rakesh before going to anyone else," Damani told Moneycontrol.

288.title: Investment firm Tiger Global cuts stakes in most companies amid losses
288.article_body: US-based investment firm Tiger Global Management has slashed or completely exited most of its holdings in the second quarter, according to a filing released on Monday. Tiger Global reduced positions in Microsoft, Coinbase, DoorDash, JD.com, Nu Holdings, Snowflake, CrowdStrike Holdings and Carvana. According to the filing, the firm dissolved investments in Robinhood, Zoom Video Communications.

289.title: 72 farmers arrested for not protesting at designated site in B'luru
289.article_body: About 72 farmers were arrested on Monday for not protesting at Freedom Park, which is the only designated protesting site in Bengaluru. Farmers in Devanahalli have been protesting against Karnataka Industrial Area Development Board's (KIADB) proposal to purchase 1,777 acres of fertile land. According to reports, 387 families will lose their land if KIADB goes ahead with the acquisition.

290.title: It’s nation’s demand that Nitish Kumar leads country, Oppn: JD(U) MLA
290.article_body: JD(U) MLA Leshi Singh on Tuesday said that Bihar CM Nitish Kumar will take the state to new heights. "It’s the demand of the nation that he leads the country, leads the Opposition in the country," Singh added. "Mahagathbandhan government will work well, the pace of development will increase and work will be firmly done," Singh stated.

291.title: Shiv Sena MLA slaps catering manager over quality of food for labourers; video surfaces
291.article_body: Rebel Shiv Sena MLA Santosh Bangar purportedly abused and slapped a private catering manager on Monday over serving poor quality mid-day meal food to labourers in his constituency of Hingoli in Maharashtra. A video of the incident has surfaced online and has gone viral on social media. Notably, Bangar had joined Eknath Shinde's camp minutes before the Assembly floor test.

292.title: Apple lays off about 100 contract-based recruiters in a rare move: Report
292.article_body: Apple laid off about 100 contract-based recruiters across regions in the past week in a rare move for the world's most valuable company, Bloomberg reported. Terminated contractors will reportedly receive pay and medical benefits for two weeks. During the earnings call, CEO Tim Cook had said that Apple will be "deliberate" with spending decisions as it faces an economic slowdown.

293.title: Took Navy base pics, flew drone; police said 'Not allowed to do it': Aayush
293.article_body: Actor Aayush Sharma recalled an incident when he got in trouble with police while he was a student. "I went somewhere in South Mumbai and took pictures of a Navy base, I had flown a drone. Suddenly they told me 'you aren't allowed to do this' and I said 'I'm so sorry'," he added.

294.title: Putin critic Navalny says he’s in solitary confinement
294.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin's critic Alexey Navalny on Monday said prison officials ordered him to serve at least three days in solitary confinement following his efforts to create a labour union in jail. He added that prison authorities have warned that it would become his "permanent residence" unless he reconsiders his "attitude". Navalny is currently serving an 11.5-year sentence.

295.title: Female SI catches mobile snatcher who was trying to escape in Delhi
295.article_body: A female Sub-Inspector (SI) of the Delhi Police, Kiran Sethi, caught a person who was trying to escape after snatching the phone of a man waiting at a bus stand in Kamla Market, officials said on Monday. The 30-year-old accused was previously involved in two cases of snatching, DCP (Central) Shweta Chauhan said. The mobile was recovered, she added.

296.title: 2 arrested for stabbing during communal clashes in Karnataka's Shivamogga
296.article_body: Police arrested two accused in connection with Karnataka's Shivamogga stabbing case during communal clashes, ADGP Law and Order Alok Kumar said. Notably, two others are absconding, he added. "We will seize the accused's properties," Kumar stated. Section 144 was imposed in parts of Shivamogga after Hindu activists protested against attempts to remove Veer Savarkar's poster on Independence Day.

297.title: I believe Virat will find form in Asia Cup: Sourav Ganguly
297.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly has said former India captain Virat Kohli, who has been on a break since the England tour, will find his form in the upcoming Asia Cup. "Let him practice, let him play matches. He is a big player and has scored plenty of runs. I am hopeful that he will make a comeback," stated Ganguly.

298.title: 'Kejriwal model' can make India a world leader:  Manish Sisodia
298.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said that "Kejriwal model" is the only proven blueprint that can make India a world leader. Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's Independence Day speech, he said, "PM presented vision of making India a developed nation...This will be possible only when the Centre will put politics aside and work collaboratively on blueprint given by Delhi CM."

299.title: IAF rescues 2 persons trapped in flash floods in J&K's Kathua
299.article_body: The Indian Air Force rescued two persons trapped in the Ujh river following flash floods in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district. Over a dozen animals were also trapped in the river but they couldn't be saved. According to reports, two IAF helicopters deployed for rescue operations have saved seven people in the district so far.

300.title: President Droupadi Murmu greets people on Parsi New Year
300.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu congratulated citizens on the occasion of Navroz - Parsi New Year. The President said, “On the auspicious occasion of Parsi New Year, I extend my warm greetings and best wishes to all my fellow citizens, especially our Parsi brothers and sisters. The Parsi community has significantly contributed to the development of our nation through their hard work."

301.title: Trump's ex-lawyer Giuliani a target in criminal probe into 2020 election
301.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump's ex-lawyer Rudy Giuliani is a target in the criminal investigation into possible illegal attempts to interfere in 2020 election in Georgia. Giuliani could face criminal charges from the investigation by Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis. On Wednesday, Trump's former lawyer will testify before a special grand jury empanelled on Willis' request.

302.title: Giriraj Singh challenges Bihar CM to form his own govt
302.article_body: Union Minister Giriraj Singh criticised Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and called him "amarbel". Singh said, "Nitish Babu will break the record of being CM for 20 years, but he is like an 'amarbel' that will never be able to become a tree. Bharatiya Janata Party made him the Chief Minister last year. I challenge Nitish to form his own government."

303.title: Tricolour hoisted at world’s highest battlefield
303.article_body: The Indian Army soldiers hoisted the Tricolour at the Siachen Glacier on the occasion of Independence Day and sang the National Anthem. They also posed for the cameras with the National Flag. The Fire and Fury Corps of the Indian Army shared the video on Twitter showing jawans walking with the National Flag and hoisting it.

304.title: 7,500 sq ft Tricolour displayed at Dal Lake in Srinagar on I-Day
304.article_body: In a joint effort by Ministry of Tourism and two educational institutions, a 7,500 square feet Tricolour was displayed at the bank of Srinagar's Dal Lake on Monday, as part of 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign, ministry said. The flag weighed between 80-85 kg with supporting elements. The same Tricolour was displayed at Gujarat's Statue of Unity on October 31, 2021.

305.title: MSRTC plans to run electric buses from Thane & Borivali to Pune
305.article_body: The Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) is planning to run air-conditioned electric buses, called Shivai, from Thane and Borivali to Pune. The Shivai buses will replace MSRTC's Shivneri buses on the route. "We have placed an order for 150 air-conditioned electric buses and the first phase of the deliveries is expected in October," MSRTC MD Shekhar Channe said.

306.title: Court approves Apple's $30.5 million settlement in bag check lawsuit
306.article_body: A federal judge in California approved Apple Inc's $30.5 million settlement in a lawsuit that claimed that the company didn't pay nearly 15,000 retail workers for the time they spent in security checks after their shift. In 2020, the California Supreme Court ruled that state law mandated workers to be paid when they go through mandatory security checks.

307.title: India sees 8,813 new COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, lowest in 63 days
307.article_body: India has reported 8,813 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, a drop of 40.9% over the previous day and lowest since June 14. India also reported 29 deaths, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Active cases in the country reached 1,11,252, while the daily positivity rate stood at 4.15%.

308.title: Ronaldo was decisive: Ballon d'Or organisers on his selection ahead of Messi
308.article_body: With Cristiano Ronaldo nominated for Ballon d'Or 2022 and Lionel Messi not making it to the shortlist for the first time since 2005, Ballon d'Or organisers France Football said, "Ronaldo was extremely decisive." "He became the top scorer in national football this season (117 goals)," they added. "The new criteria for...Ballon d'Or were unfavourable to Messi," stated France Football.

309.title: No corruption reported at central level under PM Modi: Maha Governor
309.article_body: Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari on Monday said there hasn't been any corruption at the central level in last eight years of PM Modi's government. "In some places (states), officials give in writing that leaders are demanding bribes...how unfortunate it is for the country," Koshyari said. He was addressing a gathering in Pune to mark 75 years of Zilla Parishad.

310.title: Giving it the Zidane, jokes Rio Ferdinand on Darwin Nunez's headbutt
310.article_body: Reacting to Liverpool's Darwin Nunez being sent off in a Premier League match against Crystal Palace following a headbutt, ex-Manchester United defender Rio Ferdinand jokingly tweeted, "Giving it the [Zinedine] Zidane." Liverpool were held to a 1-1 draw. France's Zidane was sent off in the 2006 FIFA World Cup final for headbutting former Italy defender Marco Materazzi.

311.title: Rohit Sharma posts pic with National Flag; Twitter users claim its 'photoshopped'
311.article_body: Rohit Sharma posted a picture of himself holding the National Flag on Independence Day and tweeted, "75 years of independence." Reacting to his picture, several Twitter users pointed out that the image is photoshopped. One of the users zoomed in on the picture and wrote, "I thought just the flag was edited, but rod too."

312.title: Apple threatening to fire me for posting TikTok video on security tips: Employee
312.article_body: A New York-based Apple employee has alleged that the company is threatening to fire her for posting a viral TikTok video on iPhone security tips. Paris Campbell had posted a video asking a woman not to remove her lost iPhone from Apple ID in response to blackmailers. Campbell was told she breached company policy by identifying herself as Apple employee.

313.title: Former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee's foster daughter pays tribute on his death anniversary
313.article_body: Former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee's foster daughter Namita Kaul Bhattacharya paid floral tribute at 'Sadaiv Atal' in Delhi on his death anniversary on Tuesday. The former PM had adopted Namita, who is the daughter of Rajkumari Kaul, Vajpayee's classmate in college and his companion. President Droupadi Murmu and PM Narendra Modi also paid their tributes to former PM Vajpayee.

314.title: CPI(M) leader hacked to death in Kerala, party blames BJP, RSS
314.article_body: A 40-year-old CPI(M) leader, K Shajahan, was hacked to death in Kerala's Palakkad district by a six-member gang on Sunday, police said. He was attacked in the Kottekad region with sharp-edged weapons, added police. He was declared brought dead at a hospital. The party blamed the BJP and the RSS for the murder but both refuted the allegation.

315.title: Former BCCI Secretary Amitabh Choudhary passes away due to heart attack
315.article_body: Former BCCI Acting Secretary Amitabh Choudhary passed away on Tuesday morning after suffering a heart attack. Choudhary had served as Jharkhand State Cricket Association (JSCA) President from 2002 to 2017. He was also a former IPS officer, having served as Additional DGP of Jharkhand. Choudhary also held the post of Chairman of Jharkhand Public Service Commission (JPSC) for 20 months.

316.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states; list released
316.article_body: The IMD has predicted isolated very heavy rainfall in Rajasthan, west Madhya Pradesh and Gujarat on Tuesday. Heavy rainfall is likely over Odisha and West Bengal on August 18 and 19 and over Jharkhand, Chhattisgarh and east Madhya Pradesh on August 19. Meanwhile, heavy falls are likely over Himachal Pradesh on August 18 and Uttarakhand on August 18 and 19.

317.title: Donald Trump's passports returned after he says FBI 'stole' them during raid
317.article_body: Passports belonging to Donald Trump have been returned to the former US President after last week's FBI search of his Mar-a-Lago home, a Justice Department official told NBC News. Trump had said agents "stole my three passports, along with everything else". "This is an assault on a political opponent at a level never seen before in our country," he added.

318.title: Entire Cabinet reflects Bihar's interest, you will see that: RJD MP
318.article_body: Ahead of Bihar Cabinet expansion, RJD MP Manoj Kumar Jha said that it is not just people who will join the Cabinet, every worker and MLA of RJD is a part of it. "They may not join under their names but there will be everyone's participation," Jha added. "The entire Cabinet reflects Bihar's interest, you will see that," Jha stated.

319.title: Ex-BJP MLA Amrita Meghwal threatened at gunpoint in Rajasthan
319.article_body: Former BJP MLA Amrita Meghwal was allegedly threatened at gunpoint by four to five unidentified people after they stopped her vehicle while she was travelling from Ajmer to Jalore in Rajasthan, police said. An FIR has been filed in the matter. The accused also smashed the windscreen of the vehicle, a Station House Officer (SHO) said.

320.title: First is Alia Bhatt: Naga Chaitanya on actresses he wishes to work with
320.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya, during an interview, was asked about the actresses he wishes to work with in future. To this, the actor said, "There are many...First is Alia Bhatt. I love her performances." He further named Priyanka Chopra and Kareena Kapoor Khan and said he looked up to their work. "Katrina Kaif, I found her really beautiful," he concluded.

321.title: Not a diktat: Maha Min on rule to say 'Vande Mataram' on receiving calls
321.article_body: Maharashtra's newly appointed Cultural Affairs Minister Sudhir Mungantiwar said that the use of "Vande Mataram" instead of "hello" by government employees while receiving phone calls was not a diktat but it was just a suggestion. His clarification came after he received criticism from NCP leaders Ajit Pawar and Chhagan Bhujbal and Raza Academy chief Muhammad Saeed Noori.

322.title: Wild elephants attack people in Assam; 3 including child killed
322.article_body: Three persons, including a child, were killed after wild elephants attacked people in a village in Assam's Goalpara on Monday. A herd of wild elephants had come to the area in search of food from the nearby hill area of Meghalaya, according to a forest official. The incident took place along Assam-Meghalaya's bordering area, a Forest Range Officer said.

323.title: China sanctions 7 Taiwanese officials for supporting independence
323.article_body: China has sanctioned seven Taiwanese officials for supporting Taiwan's independence, Chinese state news agency Xinhua said. Among those sanctioned are Hsiao Bi-khim, Taiwan's envoy to US, and chief of Taiwan's National Security Council, Wellington Koo. This comes after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited Taiwan, a move China said had sent a wrong signal to pro-independence forces on the island.

324.title: Hyderabad Police officer among 5 killed in road accident in K'taka
324.article_body: Five persons died and four others were injured in a road accident that took place in Karnataka's Bidar district on Monday. The deceased included G Giridhar, who worked as head constable with Hyderabad Police, his family and their driver. According to police, the accident took place as the car they were travelling in collided with the truck near a check-post.

325.title: How does the Premier League table read after Gameweek 2?
325.article_body: Two-time defending champions Manchester City are on top of the Premier League points table with six points from two games in the season so far. Arsenal, also with two wins, are placed second due to goal difference and are followed by Brentford. Manchester United are at the bottom for the first time in 30 years after the second weekend.

326.title: Maximum output through limited resources: Next CJI on agenda for term
326.article_body: Justice Uday Umesh Lalit, who will succeed CJI NV Ramana as the next Chief Justice of India, said the agenda for his term would be "maximum output through the limited resources". "It can be achieved by clubbing cases...listing matters that can be representative in other cases which are capable of disposing of many pending matters in lower authorities," he added.

327.title: Brazil's Lula holds 12% lead over incumbent Bolsonaro: Opinion poll
327.article_body: Former Brazilian President Lula da Silva has a lead over incumbent Jair Bolsonaro by 12-percentage-point, a new IPEC opinion poll showed. Lula, the leftist leader, has 44% voter support while Bolsonaro, the far-right leader, has 32% voter support in the first round of election, the survey said. Lula is expected to win run-off on October 30 by a 16-point lead.

328.title: Video of Johnny Depp's lookalike at religious ceremony in Iran goes viral
328.article_body: A video of a man attending a religious ceremony in Iran has gone viral on social media for his resemblance to Hollywood actor Johnny Depp. The video first appeared on TikTok and was later shared on other platforms such as Reddit. According to local media, the man's name is Amin Sa'les and he is a model.

329.title: People said 'It's a video of Punjabi wedding': Mohnish on 'Hum Aapke...'
329.article_body: Mohnish Bahl recalled the initial reactions to the 1994 film 'Hum Aapke Hain Koun..!' and revealed, "Some said that 'Yeh toh Punjabi shaadi ka video hai (It's a video of a Punjabi wedding)'." However, Mohnish stated that director Sooraj Barjatya made 'Hum Aapke Hain Koun..!' with his conviction. The film featured Salman Khan and Madhuri Dixit.

330.title: No country’s judges have workload like that handled by judges in India: Rijiju
330.article_body: Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju said it's easy to make sweeping comments on what the judiciary must do but reality is that India with its teeming population faces "unique challenges" which are "not easy to handle". "Each judge (in India) disposes of 40-50 cases in a day...judges of no other country have this kind of workload to handle," Rijiju added.

331.title: Walmart reaches video-streaming deal to offer Paramount+ to members
331.article_body: Walmart has struck a deal with Paramount Global to offer Paramount+ streaming service to the subscribers of its membership program. Walmart+ members will get access to Paramount's "essential" plan, which costs $4.99 per month and includes commercials. Members can also avail of the $9.99-a-month service without commercials. With this Walmart seeks to challenge Amazon's Prime membership programme.

332.title: Chinese 'spy ship' arrives at Sri Lanka port amid protest by India
332.article_body: A Chinese ship with abilities to track satellites and intercontinental missiles arrived at Hambantota port in Sri Lanka this morning. The ship, Yuan Wang 5, was allowed to dock on the condition that it will not carry out any research while in Sri Lankan waters. Sri Lanka had earlier asked China to defer the ship's planned visit after India's protest.

333.title: 4 including retired policeman, wife die as truck rams into house in UP
333.article_body: At least four persons, including a retired sub-inspector and his wife, died and five others were injured on Monday after a truck rammed into a house in Uttar Pradesh's Mainpuri, police said. "Two people in the truck also died...One still stuck in debris," Mainpuri SP added last night. The accident took place after the driver lost control of the truck.

334.title: Nothing to do with talent: Apurva on being picked for Pardes over Salman
334.article_body: Recalling his role in filmmaker Subhash Ghai's Shah Rukh Khan-starrer 'Pardes', which Salman Khan was interested in portraying, actor Apurva Agnihotri said, "It has nothing to do with my talent." "I've to thank Shatrughan Sinha's wife Punam...She got in touch with Mr Ghai," added Apurva. Ghai earlier said he refused to cast Salman as he needed someone who was stylish.

335.title: Karan offered me Bollywood film after Arjun Reddy, I was not ready then: Vijay
335.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda said that filmmaker Karan Johar offered him a Bollywood movie after watching 'Arjun Reddy'. "Then I was not ready, and now, we approached with Liger as it has the pan-India appeal. He supported us well in every aspect," he added. Vijay also spoke about his character in his upcoming movie 'Liger'.

336.title: No one else 'will be stupid enough' to play Test cricket past 40: Anderson
336.article_body: England's 40-year-old pacer James Anderson has said no one else will be "stupid enough" to play Test cricket past 40 in the future. "Everything that has gone in the world with franchise cricket...short forms of the game. I can't see anyone wanting to play Test cricket for this long," he added. Anderson is currently preparing to play his 173rd Test.

337.title: Sensex rises to 59,761 points, Nifty hits 17,775 in opening trade
337.article_body: Benchmark indices opened in green on Tuesday with Sensex and Nifty jumping 298.61 and 76.60 points, respectively. The Sensex opened at 59,761.39 points and Nifty at 17,774.80. Mahindra & Mahindra, Hero MotoCorp, Asian Paints, Eicher Motors and Britannia Industries were among the major Nifty gainers, while Grasim Industries, Hindalco Industries, Apollo Hospitals, Tata Steel and ONGC slipped.

338.title: WeWork Founder raises funds for new startup, reportedly at $1 billion valuation
338.article_body: WeWork Founder Adam Neumann has raised funds from Andreessen Horowitz for Flow, his new residential real estate company focused on rentals. According to The New York Times, Flow has raised $350 million from Andreessen Horowitz, marking the venture capital firm's largest individual check ever. Flow, which is yet to start operations, is reportedly valued at $1 billion after the fundraise.

339.title: Viral video shows Agra woman beating guard with stick, abusing him for ill-treating dogs
339.article_body: A video showing a woman beating a security guard with a stick and abusing him for allegedly mistreating dogs is going viral on social media. The man is reportedly an ex-serviceman working as a security guard in LIC Campus. Meanwhile, Agra Police said that they have launched an investigation into the incident.

340.title: Data of over one lakh members of a Mumbai club hacked
340.article_body: Data of over one lakh members of a club in Mumbai was recently hacked and put up on sale. The data included details like - names, mobile numbers, email IDs and business classification of members. The matter came to light after a few members received emails from unknown persons claiming to have shared the information online for ₹19,999.

341.title: William Ruto wins Kenya's Presidential election amid dispute
341.article_body: Deputy President William Ruto was on Monday declared the winner of Kenya's Presidential election amid violent protests and claims of rigging. Ruto had won 50.49% of the vote against rival Raila Odinga's 48.5%, according to the official results. Four of the seven members of the electoral commission have refused to endorse the result, saying it was "opaque".

342.title: A$AP Rocky charged with assault for allegedly firing at a former friend in LA last year
342.article_body: Rapper A$AP Rocky has been charged with assault with a firearm for allegedly firing twice at a former friend in Los Angeles last November. Earlier this month, A$AP Relli came forward as the person shot at by Rocky and said he plans to file a lawsuit. He alleged that Rocky lured him to an obscure location "to discuss a disagreement".

343.title: Doja Cat responds after social media users criticise her for shaving her head, eyebrows
343.article_body: American singer Doja Cat has responded to social media users who criticised her for shaving her head and eyebrows. "I won a Grammy and traveled the f***ing globe...I make hit after hit after hit and you all want me to look f***able for you...Go f**k yourselves," she tweeted. During an Instagram Live, Doja had said, "I never liked having hair."

344.title: 4 dead, 2 injured as truck rams into car on Delhi-Jaipur highway in Gurugram
344.article_body: At least four persons were killed and two were critically injured after a truck rammed into their car on the Delhi-Jaipur highway on Monday night in Haryana's Gurugram, police said. The accident took place within Bilaspur Police Station limits. "The deceased were residents of Delhi. Police took the bodies into their custody, the investigation [is] on," Gurugram Police added.

345.title: Thought 'Mind...' director was creepy uncle as he kept staring at me: Mini
345.article_body: Actress Mini Mathur recalled meeting 'Mind The Malhotras' director Sahil Sangha for the first time. She stated, "I was at lunch when I met Sahil...he kept looking at me and I was like...'Is he a creepy uncle?'" She added that Sahil said, "I'm going to talk to you about something." "The very next day he cast me," she concluded.

346.title: Kirsten just said 'Enjoy': Harbhajan on team meeting before 2011 WC final
346.article_body: Recalling the 2011 World Cup final against Sri Lanka, ex-India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh said the players were under "no pressure" before the match, with head coach Gary Kirsten simply asking them to "enjoy". Harbhajan had earlier revealed that captain MS Dhoni asked him to bowl around the wicket during the tournament's semi-final against Pakistan, helping him dismiss batter Umar Akmal.

347.title: Over 6 crore selfies with Tricolour uploaded on ‘Har Ghar Tiranga’ website
347.article_body: As many as 6,00,43,734 selfies with the Tricolour have been uploaded as of Tuesday morning on the 'Har Ghar Tiranga campaign' website as part of India's 76th Independence Day celebrations, according to the official website.
