Earlier, PM Narendra Modi gave a call to join the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' movement by hoisting or displaying the national flag at homes.

348.title: Bengaluru airport starts DigiYatra services for seamless travel
348.article_body: The beta version of the DigiYatra app was rolled out at Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport on Independence Day. The service aims to provide a seamless experience to passengers using facial recognition technology at various checkpoints, including airport entry and aircraft boarding. The service is currently available only for Android users, with iOS launch planned for later.

349.title: Cyberabad Police forms special teams to regulate traffic, control crime
349.article_body: The Cyberabad Police has formed 'Traffic Task Force' teams to help regulate traffic movement on busy roads and control crime. Six teams comprising of two policemen each were flagged off by Cyberabad Police Commissioner Stephen Raveendra on Sunday. Each team has been provided with specially designed two wheeler with a public addressing system to ensure smooth flow of vehicular movement.

350.title: I can finally exhale: Model Padma Lakshmi on ex-husband Salman Rushdie's recovery
350.article_body: Indian-American model and author Padma Lakshmi tweeted about her ex-husband Salman Rushdie's recovery after he was stabbed in New York and wrote that she was worried and wordless and "can finally exhale". "Relieved [Salman Rushdie] is pulling through after Friday's nightmare...Now hoping for swift healing," she added. Earlier, Rushdie's agent said the 75-year-old is "on the road to recovery".

351.title: Woman cheated of ₹79 lakh on promise of restaurant franchise in Pune
351.article_body: A woman has filed a complaint after she was allegedly cheated of over ₹79 lakh on the promise of getting the franchise of a restaurant chain, a Pune police official said on Monday. Three accused, who were posing as the restaurant chain's representatives, had got the woman to transfer the amount into four accounts, a cyber police assistant inspector said.

352.title: 93-yr-old man, 87-yr-old wife die as roof of Mulund building collapses
352.article_body: A 93-year-old man and his 87-year-old wife lost their lives after the roof of a residential building in Maharashtra's Mulund collapsed on Monday. "The slab from the first-floor ceiling collapsed and the deceased senior citizens were the only people present at the time. The victims were rushed to the hospital, following which they were declared dead," an official said.

353.title: 100 yrs ago my father wasn't allowed to drink water, today 9-yr-old killed for it: Meira
353.article_body: Former Lok Sabha Speaker Meira Kumar on Monday tweeted, "100 years ago my father Babu Jagjivan Ram was prohibited from drinking water in school from the pitcher meant for Savarna Hindus...Today, a nine-year-old Dalit boy has been killed for the same reason." She added, "75 long years after Independence, caste system remains our greatest enemy."

354.title: Russia is ready to offer its most advanced weapons to allies: Putin
354.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has vowed to expand military cooperation with the country's allies in Latin America, Asia and Africa. "We're ready to offer our allies and partners the most advanced types of weapons, from firearms, armour and artillery to warplanes and drones," Putin said. He also hailed Russia's military operation in Ukraine and thanked Moscow's allies for their support.

355.title: Scaler announces to offer first class for free for all learners in Aug
355.article_body: Scaler announced that its 'Dare to Dream' session will be free for all learners in August. Hosted by Anshuman Singh, 'Dare to Dream' is Scaler's first online classroom session, helping learners to gain understanding of different careers, interviews, and learning materials for excelling in tech domain. With 94% placement rate, Scaler has placed 2500+ learners in tech roles, it stated.

356.title: Bengaluru reports 870 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
356.article_body: Bengaluru reported 870 new COVID-19 infections in a day, taking the cumulative total to 18,52,818 cases, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said on Monday. No new deaths were reported, so the overall toll remained at 16,979. The number of active cases was 6,951, while the infection positivity rate stood at 6.83%.

357.title: Hyderabad civic body converts dumping sites into food street
357.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has converted the roadside, which was once used as dumping grounds, into a food street. The initiative has been taken up to create employment opportunities for youth. "Earlier the road was bad and later the MLA cleaned it and put up...stalls. I was unemployed and now I got the stall," a beneficiary said.

358.title: 1 dead after column collapses at Air Force Station in Delhi Cantt
358.article_body: One labourer died and four others were injured after a column they were constructing collapsed inside the Air Force Station in the Delhi Cantt area. Following the incident, the labourers claimed that they'd asked for safety equipment but were denied. The deceased's wife alleged that the employers didn't help and her husband died because he wasn't taken to a hospital.

359.title: Former Bihar minister and BJP MLA Subhash Singh dies aged 59
359.article_body: Former Bihar minister and BJP MLA Subhash Singh passed away aged 59 on Tuesday at Delhi's AIIMS. "Received the sad news of the demise of Shri Subhash Singh ji from Gopalganj Sadar. Praying to God to give his soul a place at his feet...Peace," Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav tweeted. Singh was undergoing treatment at AIIMS for over a month.

360.title: FIFA suspends All India Football Federation with immediate effect
360.article_body: World football governing body FIFA has suspended the All India Football Federation (AIFF) with immediate effect due to undue influence from third parties. The suspension will be lifted once the AIFF administration regains full control of the AIFF's daily affairs, FIFA stated. Further, Under-17 Women's World Cup 2022 cannot be held in India in October as currently planned, FIFA added.

361.title: Doja Cat responds after social media users criticise her for shaving her head, eyebrows
361.article_body: American singer Doja Cat has responded to social media users who criticised her for shaving her head and eyebrows. "I won a Grammy and traveled the f***ing globe...I make hit after hit after hit and you all want me to look f***able for you...Go f**k yourselves," she tweeted. During an Instagram Live, Doja had said, "I never liked having hair."

362.title: I can finally exhale: Model Padma Lakshmi on ex-husband Salman Rushdie's recovery
362.article_body: Indian-American model and author Padma Lakshmi tweeted about her ex-husband Salman Rushdie's recovery after he was stabbed in New York and wrote that she was worried and wordless and "can finally exhale". "Relieved [Salman Rushdie] is pulling through after Friday's nightmare...Now hoping for swift healing," she added. Earlier, Rushdie's agent said the 75-year-old is "on the road to recovery".

363.title: PM Modi pays floral tribute to Atal Bihari Vajpayee on his death anniversary
363.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi paid floral tribute to former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee on his death anniversary at Sadaiv Atal (Vajpayee's memorial) in New Delhi. PM Modi was accompanied by other BJP leaders including Union Home Minister Amit Shah. Vajpayee, who was India's PM for six years (1998-2004), died in 2018 at 93 years of age.

364.title: Bhopal schools to remain closed today due to heavy rainfall
364.article_body: The District Collector of Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal has directed for all schools in the state to remain closed on Tuesday. The decision has been taken in view of incessant rainfall in the area, news agency ANI reported. Reports had earlier said that water level of various dams in Madhya Pradesh has increased substantially due to the rainfall.

365.title: Social Justice Dept officials to stay in 441 Maha hostels to improve them
365.article_body: In a bid to improve the condition of hostels run by the Social Justice Department in Maharashtra, the department officials will be staying overnight at all 441 such hostels in the state, reports said. The officials will eat the dinner served to students, sleep in hostel rooms and use facilities that are being offered to students.

366.title: Apple sets Sept 5 deadline for employees to start returning to office 3 days a week
366.article_body: Apple has set a September 5 deadline for its corporate employees to be in the office at least three days per week, according to internal emails. The company will require employees to work from the office on Tuesdays, Thursdays and a third day determined by individual teams. Apple's hybrid work model, announced in June 2021, was delayed earlier this year.

367.title: Delhi witnesses less than 2,000 new COVID cases for 1st time in 12 days
367.article_body: Delhi on Monday reported 1,227 new COVID-19 cases and eight coronavirus-related deaths. This is the first time in 12 days that the daily COVID-19 cases in Delhi have been below the 2,000 mark. Notably, the daily COVID-19 positivity rate in the national capital has risen to 14.57%, compared to 12.64% on Sunday. Delhi has witnessed 19,85,822 COVID-19 cases since 2020.

368.title: Kylian Mbappe calls Messi and Ronaldo 'the greedy two'
368.article_body: PSG forward Kylian Mbappe said the Ballon d'Or award was "crushed by the greedy two", Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo. "Frankly, everything is crushed by the greedy two...that battle was pretty crazy," he said. When asked to choose between the two, Mbappe said that he couldn't as it would be like choosing between a father or mother.

369.title: 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign boosted sales of Tricolour: Traders
369.article_body: To commemorate 75 years of Indian independence, the Centre launched the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign which helped increase the demand and sales of the tricolour, traders and flag makers said. "There has been unprecedented demand for the national flag this year...We have already supplied 10 lakh pieces of the national flag," said Mumbai-based The Flag Company's Co-founder Dalvir Singh Nagi.

370.title: Kashmiris threatened to hoist national flag: Mehbooba Mufti
370.article_body: Former J&K CM and Peoples Democratic Party President Mehbooba Mufti said that people in Kashmir were threatened and made to hoist the Tricolour. In a series of tweets, she said, "J&K administration shamelessly boasts about Kashmiris hoisting Indian flag. Truth is they were threatened to do so or else face the consequences." She called the government's patriotism "pseudo and monetised".

371.title: Senior Kenyan election officials disown presidential poll results
371.article_body: The deputy chairperson of Kenya's election commission and three other commissioners on Monday disassociated themselves with the results of the recently concluded presidential elections. "We are not able to take ownership of the results that will be announced," deputy chairperson Juliana Cherera announced. This came shortly before the announcement of the results by the election commission.

372.title: Suryakumar is a bit like De Villiers, no. 4 is his best batting spot: Ponting
372.article_body: Comparing India batter Suryakumar Yadav with AB de Villiers, Ricky Ponting said the India batter scores 360 degrees around the ground, a bit like the ex-South African cricketer. "The lap shots, the late cuts...the ramps over the keeper's head," he added. Talking about Suryakumar's batting spot in India's squad, Ponting said number four is the 31-year-old's best spot.

373.title: Namibian cheetahs to be brought to MP given health checkups
373.article_body: Cheetahs from Namibia, which could soon be settled into Madhya Pradesh's Kuno National Park, were given their first health check-up by an international team of experts. The Indian High Commission in Windhoek tweeted photos of the animals undergoing the examination. Last month, India signed an MoU with Namibia to reintroduce the animals back into the wild.

374.title: Used to prepare the night before, getting our kites ready: Kohli on I-Day childhood memory
374.article_body: Talking about his childhood memories of Independence Day, Virat Kohli said, "In Delhi...there's a big culture of flying kites on 15th August...so that used to be a super special moment." He added, "We all used to prepare a lot the night before, getting our kites and everything ready...so that we can find a good time and go to fly kites."

375.title: What are the features of the Made-in-India howitzer used for I-Day gun salute?
375.article_body: The Made-in-India howitzer ATAGS was used in the customary 21-gun salute during the Independence Day ceremony for the first time ever at the Red Fort on Monday. The long-range artillery gun with a 48-km maximum range was developed by DRDO. It has advanced features ensuring quick deployability, high mobility, an automatic command and control system and an advanced communication system.

376.title: Shakira to relocate to Miami amid tax fraud claims: Reports
376.article_body: Pop star Shakira is reportedly leaving Spain to relocate to Miami amid the alleged tax fraud case. Her family friend and Douglas Elliman realtor Ana Lourdes Martinez described Miami as Shakira's "refuge". Shakira is accused of failing to pay taxes between 2012 and 2014, a period during which she claimed she was living in the Bahamas.

377.title: More than deserved: Alcaraz on fellow Spaniard Busta's 1st 1000 Masters title
377.article_body: Following Spaniard Pablo Carreño Busta's maiden ATP 1000 Masters title in Montreal, compatriot Carlos Alcaraz said, "Pablo!!!! Congratulations and more than deserved! Happy for you!" Argentina's Diego Schwartzman said, "Giant pablito. A great partner/friend...Congratulations." Busta beat Hubert Hurkacz 3-6, 6-3, 6-3 in Sunday's final. Busta is the sixth Spaniard to win an ATP Tour title this year.

378.title: CWG 2022 medal winners from Haryana to be honoured on Aug 16
378.article_body: The Commonwealth Games 2022 medal winners from Haryana will be honoured by the state government in Gurugram on Tuesday. The gold, silver and bronze medallists will be awarded ₹1.5 crore, ₹75 lakh and ₹50 lakh respectively. However, all participating athletes from Haryana will get ₹7.5 lakh. Notably, Haryana's sportspersons won 20 medals, including nine gold medals, in CWG 2022.

379.title: Stoinis to not face sanction for accusing Pak bowler Hasnain of chucking
379.article_body: Australian cricketer Marcus Stoinis will not face any formal sanction for questioning Pakistani pacer Mohammad Hasnain's bowling action during their match in The Hundred. Stoinis was spoken to by match referee Dean Cosker after the incident. The controversy took place after Hasnain took Stoinis' wicket with a quicker delivery during the match.

380.title: Snapchat+ crosses 1 million paid subscribers within 6 weeks from launch
380.article_body: Snapchat's parent company, Snap Inc, on Monday said that the company's paid subscription plan Snapchat+, which launched in June, now has over one million subscribers across the globe. According to a report, Snap had registered $7.3 million in in-app revenue within 30 days of Snapchat+ launch. Snap also introduced four new features for Snapchat+.

381.title: Arsene Wenger names Henry among his 7 favourite Arsenal players
381.article_body: Arsenal's longest-serving manager Arsene Wenger named seven players when he was asked to name his favourite player from his time with the club. Thierry Henry, Dennis Bergkamp, Patrick Vieira, Robert Pires, Jack Wilshere, Aaron Ramsey and Cesc Fabregas were the players Wenger mentioned. Wenger had managed the London club from 1996 to 2018.

382.title: ICC needs to put more time to ensure ODI, Test survival: Kapil Dev
382.article_body: Former India captain Kapil Dev urged the ICC to put more time into ensuring survival of ODI and Test cricket. "I think it's fading out...ICC has to put more time...(to) ensure survival of one-day cricket, Test match cricket," said Kapil Dev. He said he fears international cricket would be played only during the World Cup.

383.title: Honoured to receive your I-Day wishes: PM Modi to Mauritius PM
383.article_body: After being wished on the occasion of India completing its 75 years of Independence, PM Narendra Modi thanked Mauritius Prime Minister Pravind Kumar Jugnauth. "Honoured to receive your Independence Day wishes. India and Mauritius have very deep cultural linkages. Our nations are also cooperating in a wide range of subjects for the mutual benefit of our citizens," PM Modi said.

384.title: All Australians applaud India’s successes: Aus PM Anthony Albanese
384.article_body: Australian PM Anthony Albanese wished India on completing 75 years of Independence and said that "all Australians applaud India's successes". "We also give thanks for the contribution of our Indian-Australian community to our society...and to the links between our nations," he said. Meanwhile, PM Narendra Modi replied, "The friendship between India and Australia has stood the test of time."

385.title: Tourist ban shouldn't make life harder for Kremlin critics: Germany
385.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Monday said that any decision regarding a proposed entry ban on Russian tourists in EU should not make it harder for critics of Russian leadership to flee the country. Several EU leaders have called for a ban on the entry of Russian tourists into the bloc's territory over the ongoing invasion of Ukraine by Russia.

386.title: Pietersen sends I-Day wishes to Indian fans through tweet in Hindi, fans correct him
386.article_body: Ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen took to Twitter to wish his Indian fans on India's 76th Independence Day in Hindi. Several fans pointed out mistakes in his tweet, with one saying, "Please don't use Google Translate." Another wrote, "Stand tall doesn't equate to 'lamba khade raho'...but we got your emotions." Another user mentioned it's India's 76th Independence Day not 75th.

387.title: Meta partners with DoorDash for delivery of Marketplace items in US: Reports
387.article_body: Online delivery platform DoorDash and Meta have partnered to deliver Facebook Marketplace items in US. The items will only be delivered within a radius of 25 km and need to be small enough to fit in the trunk of a car. Currently, it has not been made clear how much it would cost to use DoorDash to make the deliveries.

388.title: Criticism of judiciary must be within bounds: India's next Chief Justice
388.article_body: India's next Chief Justice Uday Umesh Lalit on Monday said, "The public has the right to see whether our judgments are up to the expectations of society or not." However, he added, there must be a line that should be drawn. "Any criticism is a pointer that even...judiciary can do...course corrections...but that criticism should be within bounds," he added.

389.title: CA aiming for cricket's inclusion at Brisbane Olympics in 2032
389.article_body: Cricket Australia is aiming to include cricket in the 2032 Brisbane Olympics. The target is part of a five-year strategic plan named 'Where the Game Grows', which includes nine targets. "This strategy contains both a vision and a clear plan for how we can achieve bold, transformative change while also meeting our core responsibilities," CA CEO Nick Hockley said.

390.title: Johnny Depp to direct first film after 25 years
390.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp will be directing Italian painter Amedeo Modigliani's biopic, which reportedly will be co-produced by Al Pacino. The film will be his first direction in 25 years after 'The Brave' (1997). The actor said he is "incredibly honoured, humbled" to bring Modigliani's story on screen. He called it a story of "great hardship, but eventual triumph".

391.title: No one can ignore Savarkar's role in India's freedom struggle: Sena MP
391.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi said nobody can ignore Vinayak Damodar Savarkar's role in India's freedom struggle and added that India runs on the energy and principles of Mahatma Gandhi. "Every contribution by different freedom fighters played a significant role in independence," she said. "If PM Narendra Modi mentioned Gandhi's name, I hope he follows his path too," she added.

392.title: PM took Mahatma Gandhi's name, hope he follows his path: Shiv Sena MP
392.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi on Monday took a swipe at PM Narendra Modi, saying she hopes he follows the path of Mahatma Gandhi as he mentioned 'Bapu' in his Independence Day address. She said that the role played by VD Savarkar can't be ignored, adding that every freedom fighter's contribution played a significant role in India's independence.

393.title: EV startup Faraday Future to raise funding of $600 mn
393.article_body: Electric Vehicle startup Faraday Future Intelligent Electric Inc said that it will raise funding of $600 million. As part of a new financing facility, the startup will receive an $52 million of committed funds. The EV maker said that it is in talks with investors in US and globally for additional near-term funding.

394.title: Civil aviation sector's safety, security is paramount: Scindia
394.article_body: Union Minister for Civil Aviation Jyotiraditya Scindia has said that the safety and security of the country's civil aviation space is "paramount". "We make sure that every occurrence is reported," Scindia said. He added, "For both safety and security, we have the regulators in place that monitor compliance on those parameters. BCAS for security and DGCA for safety."

395.title: US sanctions 3 Liberian officials including President's top aide
395.article_body: The US imposed sanctions on three government officials of Liberia on Monday for their alleged involvement in "ongoing public corruption", the Treasury Department informed. One of the sanctioned individuals is President George Weah's chief of staff, Nathaniel McGill. "These officials have undermined democracy in Liberia for their own personal benefit," a senior Treasury Department official stated.

396.title: American billionaire investor Daniel Loeb's Third Point re-invests in Disney
396.article_body: American billionaire investor Daniel Loeb's hedge fund Third Point has announced a new stake in Disney, months after it partially liquidated its stake in the firm. In a letter to Disney CEO, Loeb also suggested a slew of changes, including a spin-off of its sports network ESPN, reports said on Monday. Shares of Disney reportedly jumped 2% on the news.

397.title: Omicron-specific COVID-19 vaccine for India expected in 6 months: SII's Poonawalla
397.article_body: Serum Institute of India's (SII) CEO Adar Poonawalla has said that a COVID-19 vaccine that specifically targets the Omicron variant is expected in India in the next six months, reports said on Monday. SII is the world's biggest vaccine maker and it manufactures the Oxford/AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine, sold as Covishield in India.

398.title: Harshal Patel shares video from injury rehab, says 'Back to the grind'
398.article_body: Pacer Harshal Patel, who was ruled out of India's Asia Cup 2022 squad due to a rib injury, posted a video on Instagram undergoing rehabilitation at National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru. "Back to the grind!! Sometimes the silver lining with injury is that it allows you the time to train without thinking about competition, which is precious," he wrote.

399.title: Will you hit the streets if CBI comes for me?: WB CM to TMC cadre
399.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee at a rally on Sunday asked TMC supporters if they would hit the streets if the CBI reaches her doorstep. "What will you do if they reach my house tomorrow? Will you not hit the streets?" asked Mamata to the crowd. Bengal BJP asked if her statement was an "admission of involvement in corruption".

400.title: India donates 15,000 cycles to Madagascar on 76th Independence Day
400.article_body: On the occasion of India's 76th Independence Day, India has donated 15,000 cycles to Madagascar "as a symbol of growing cooperation" between the countries, Indian Embassy in Madagascar said. India announced the donation on June 3, which is World Bicycle Day. Meanwhile, the Town Hall in Madagascar's Antananarivo had also lit up in tricolour to mark India's independence.

401.title: Man throws bomb after clash between 2 families; 12-yr-old dead, 15 injured
401.article_body: A 12-year-old boy died while 15 people were injured after a man threw a bomb at a rival group during a clash between two families in Madhya Pradesh's Indore district, police said on Monday. Police later raided several houses in the area to find out if there were more bombs. Of the injured persons, the condition of four is critical.
